campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No Kickstarter project can 100% guarantee success, including ours. That said, we previously ran a successful Kickstarter project, manufactured our product and got it into the market. We learned an incredible amount along the way, overcame numerous challenges, and we now have solid expectations and experience. While there are always risks, challenges and unexpected hurdles, this project is significantly less complicated than our previous project, and we can't wait to get into production!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Have you seen my RE-Launched Campaign Yet?
updates.update_content:
Hi 2017 Backers,
The re-launch of my Flipbook Kit is off to a fantastic start! We have more than 400 backers so far and are 60% funded! We raised more in our first 24 hours than we did in our entire previous campaign.

updates.update_userinfo: LIVE NOW ON KICKSTARTER: Andymation's Flipbook Kit
updates.update_content: My new Flipbook Kit is LIVE NOW on Kickstarter! Don't miss out on Early Bird pricing for the first 24 hours at every pledge level!

updates.update_userinfo: LIVE ON KICKSTARTER Tomorrow: Andymation's Flipbook Kit RE-LAUNCHED
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!
I'm finally re-launching my Flipbook Kit on Kickstarter tomorrow! I'm excited about all the improvements we've made to each element. Take a look:

updates.update_userinfo: Country Locations Needed and Email Updates
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers!
Please take a moment and visit http://flipbookanimationkit.com where you can register for direct email updates and provide your country location. If you are located outside the U.S. this is especially helpful as we make our new plan for international shipping fulfillment.
over and out

Hi Backers!
First of all a HUGE thanks to all of you for backing, sharing and supporting this project. We made it far but didn't reach our funding goal this first time around--so we will be relaunching as soon we can, with improvements. Please follow our updates to be notified when we relaunch. Our URL www.flipbookanimationkit.com will be linked to the new project page as soon as it is ready.

Howdy Backers
With just a few days left, I want to make a big final push. With everyone's help I think we can get there! 
Please take a moment during the next day or two and share the project on your Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, etc. Many of you have done this already--a huge thanks to you!

updates.update_userinfo: New Countries Added and Thanks Stickybones!
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers!
First of all a big thanks to the team at Stickybones for giving us a shout out in their recent update! We love their amazingly posable animation figure, and if you haven't seen their project yet, definitely check it out at http://www.stickybones.com/

Happy Tuesday Backers!
We have now reached 225 backers, so a big thanks everyone for sharing the project! Please keep sharing and re-sharing the project--every post makes a huge difference.
I wanted to let you know about a cool animation Kickstarter project which I just backed. It’s a project by Ken Cookson, who has designed a . I love that it has a built-in LED light in the lid. Please check it out at the link below and help Ken cross his funding goal! He has two days left and is very close.

Hi Backers!
First of all, we have reached nearly 200 backers, and that is awesome!
If you have not yet shared the project on your social media, please consider posting and sharing it. Each time you post is a huge help, and we still need more backers to make this happen!
International Shipping is Now Open to:

comments.content: Status on the relaunch? Isn't it supposed to be live today?

It's a shame this didn't go through. I liked the idea of adding something a little more "pro animation" to the humble flipbook to take it to another level while still keeping things simple. Since international shipping for something this size is so steep, I wonder if there should be some kind of digital perk (like a video, or a printable file?) so that people who simply can't do the international shipping no matter how low it gets can get a little something out of backing the project for more than $1.
Good luck!
Bill
I want this for instruction/classrooms!! It's amazing. Adding my name to follow your project and success here or elsewhere.

Hi - I added an extra $15 to my pledge for the extra paper pack. I hope the project makes it. If not, I'll follow you to Indiegogo. �
But don't give up! Everyone keep sharing the hell out of this project, who knows, maybe we can meet the goal. :) Good luck!

Okay looks like its time to start planning a re-launch. I think you should refine the prototype to show all the bells & whistles (like registration pegs), have a separate tier for additional flip book sets, and add some stretch goals. Since it's an LED changing the color of the light pad would be nice for people sensitive to the bright white LED. Another stretch goal could be color markers or ink sets. And also bonus flip book blanks too. Incentivize a push for more backers. ALSO make it clear from about shipping to various countries. Hope you have a success next time around. Will back it again.

Looks like a tough target Andy but I'm still hoping you get a last minute boost. (Just posted news about it to my Facebook page regardless!) P.S. Maybe a cheap little plastic pegboard - or two circle marks on the tablet - would help with the registration? Anyway.... 'Good luck' with it all! Great to keep traditional hand-drawn animation alive! Tony White/The Animator's Friend
Well looks like this unfortunately won't make the goal. Can you please run an Indiegogo after this?

Over halfway there. This project has really picked up steam in the last few days and I so desperately hope it gets funded. I'm not an artist by any stretch of the imagination, but I really do like the instruction aspect of Anthony A's post. Fingers crossed!
I LOVE FLIPBOOKS! Do you have any suggestions for registration pegs that one could attach to the lightpad?
And the reason I'm posting this is because, I pointed three people to this campaign and all three asked "does he show me how to actually MAKE one?"
Doubled my pledge from 1 to 2 deluxe kits, fingers crossed!
Hi! I would love to get a deluxe kit shipped to the Netherlands! Hope you get that one available before the finish line!!!
I know in an earlier comment you said you would have refill packs available after the campaign ends, via amazon prime and your web-site. Would refill packs be available via Amazon UK also?

Andy- You got 8 days to go an quite a few international supporters who will back if you can resolve the shipping! UK, France, Denmark, Australia & NZ. If you find a solution ASAP we can still get past the finish line.
Ignore my last comment. Read your update. Maybe start a UK or Europe only kickstarter for this separate?
On the fence about UK posting as everything is priced well anyway. But if you could find a UK distributer the postage would plummet.
This looks amazing! Currently backed at $1 cause I just can't afford to get it sent to the UK. Good luck though!
This project is epic.

Really great idea ��
Another Australian backer here, in for $1, would up pledge to 1 or 2 deluxe sets if overseas shipping option made available. Thanks and KEEP FLIPPIN people! Adrian

campaign.story:
The MostRad™ Maverick Wallet
Integrated RFID shield, protection against credit card and identity theft.
Vertical Quick-Slide card slot for chipped cards.
Imported Genuine Leather.
Traditional cash pocket for USA and International currencies. Makes for the perfect travel wallet.
8 individual card slots including a pull tab and 2 hidden pockets.
       The MostRad™ Maverick's vertical quick-slide pocket. Access your favorite card instantly.
 Quick-pull tab to access less used cards stored in the interior pocket.
 Individual interior pocket, perfect for ID's.
 The hidden interior pocket, perfect for storing larger bills, important cards, or other small valuable objects.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk and challenge this project faces is reaching the financial goal to begin mass production. With the help and pledges from all the amazing backers on my first two MostRad™ Kickstarter campaigns, I was able to launch MostRad™ globally and deliver thousands upon thousands of slim, affordable RFID protected wallets. With the help of my backers and their incredible feedback, I've hit the drawing board again and am very proud to reveal my latest design, The MostRad™ Maverick. With your pledges, we can once again bring another MostRad™ product to the market. I'm very confident in the outstanding, ongoing working relationship I have with my manufacturer since the inception of MostRad™. We have had two very smooth Kickstarter campaigns in the past and I'm confident (if funded) we will be able to deliver the finished products quickly once again! Thank you all SO much for your support over the years and I'm looking forward to another beautiful campaign! - Brandon
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: MostRad™ | MicroSlim Wallet is now LIVE!!!
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarters!
Hope everyone has been amazing! It's been a while since my last project but I have some very exciting news....
I'm extremely excited to announce that my new design (which I've been testing for the past 3 months and can confidently say is my FAVORITE wallet design BY FAR) is now live on Kickstarter!

updates.update_userinfo: ALL REWARDS HAVE BEEN SHIPPED! | MostRad™ Maverick Wallet
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarters!
I'm back with some great news... the final shipment of wallets arrived from the manufacturer this morning! Isabella and I got to work immediately and managed to fulfill every remaining pledge! They will be dropped off at our USPS first thing in the morning. All US backers should have their wallets by the end of next week, International backers should expect their wallets within 1-3 weeks. That time depends solely on your countries customs inspection times. If you do not receive your wallet within the next 3 weeks please contact me and we will check out your tracking and get you a replacement if need be!

updates.update_userinfo: FIRST BATCH SHIPPED! | MostRad™ Maverick Wallet
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarters!
Just wrapped up a non-stop day of printing shipping labels and packaging and I (with the help of my amazing girlfriend Isabella) managed to complete the entire first batch in about 8 hours! All the early bird pledges and single order Black Mavericks with Embossed Logo's have been packaged up. About 60% of the single order Black Maverick No Logo's have also been packaged up. These will be dropped off tomorrow morning as soon as USPS opens!

updates.update_userinfo: FIRST BATCH IS IN! | MostRad™ Maverick Wallet
updates.update_content:
Hello Kickstarters!
I want to thank all of you for the amazing comments and support from the last update. We have truly built an amazing little community together and being able to share this process with everyone each step of the way really makes this a team environment. I love being able to read everyone's thoughts and ideas to mature and progress these wallets. So thank you all again for being so active and supportive, it really makes a world of difference and I could not do any of this without you!

Hello Kickstarters!
Hope everyone has been well, I'd like to bring everyone up to speed really quick!
I believe I confused many of you with my last update, I'm terribly sorry if I did not word that statement clearly. When I stated the wallets were set for delivery on March 10th, I meant set for delivery to my office. Not out for delivery to the backers just yet unfortunately!

Hey Kickstarters!
The big week has arrived! Unfortunately, it took my manufacturer a few extra days to inspect, package, and ship but the wallets are finally in the air as of yesterday and set for delivery March 10th! I really hoped to get these out sooner but I'd rather the product be completely inspected and prepped for shipment rather than rushed. Thank you all so much for your patience. I'll have some pictures up for everyone over the weekend!

Hey Kickstarters!
Back with some awesome news for everyone!
I spoke with my manufacturer last night and they are approaching completion! They will have the first batch shipped out to me by the end of February and then the remaining second batch by March 3rd. I know they've been working as fast as they can and I can't thank them enough for their dedication to bringing my wallet designs to life. I'll begin shipping upon arrival. With my previous Kickstarter campaigns, I was able to ship out 1,000+ wallets within 2-3 days working 18+ hours a day. I will absolutely be doing the same this time around, I want to make sure everyone can get their hands on the Maverick as soon as humanly possible! You guys are the best!

Hey Kickstarters!
Hope everyone has had a great start to 2017! I've got great news! 
Production has begun!

Hey Kickstarters!
Happy New Year! 
Hoping everyone had an amazing holiday and great start to 2017!
Surveys

Hey Kickstarters,
Guess what? 
YOU GUYS DID IT!!! 
This campaign was fully funded within 24 hours and ended with an outstanding 1,200 backers! Words cannot express how grateful I am for each and every one of you. Whether you are a supporter from the beginning, or joining for the first time, I humbly for taking this journey with me and literally being the sole reason this company exists. None of this is possible without ! Thank you so much for the support, I cannot wait to get the Maverick into your hands!

I definitely would not recomend this going forward nor back another project by the developer.

This is the third incarnation of this wallet I've gotten. Pro: real leather is nice. Feels good in the hand, easy to hold. I didn't have any strong smell issues with the wallet. Cons: It's no longer a minimalist wallet. The pull tab and cash spot in the middle of the wallet add to the bulk so it no longer disappears into my scrub pockets. It's like a regular wallet with the extra bulk and that's disappointing. As a previous poster has said, once the right card slots are filled with cards it becomes hard to pull or put cash in or out because there's no give in the leather. The stitching on my wallet is ok, but it doesn't match the sample wallet on the KS page and I can already tell where it's going to fail. I prefer the previous version of this wallet.
And then, obviously, a better distribution of the cards, as well as better access to the bills pocket.
And some small black dots on the brown leather when I take it out. Quality is going down.
got it, card slots are problem. 5 cards on one side is poor design. worse than last year (2015) version smaller wallet. Like Jay said, hard to get out some cards too.
Not a fan of the wallet. some slots are hard to get the card out. would not purchase again from mostrad

I would also give this wallet a pretty low rating it has not done any breaking in and over all has that low quality feel and look to it. The smell will go away pretty quick if you give it a rub down with a damp cloth I soaked a cloth in Pinesol water and then rung it out really well and rubbed it down pretty thoroughly then gave the wallet a coating of Neatsfoot oil that gave it a new wallet smell with just a hint of clean. This wallet can hold a load of stuff you are that kind of person. Craft and lore had a campaign years ago and their stuff is great I would suggest those of you in need to check them out. I would say I got what i paid for, I just paid for a Walmart quality wallet and that is not my usual cup of tea.
Thanks skyler for the suggestion, I collect wallets and have plenty to rotate and this one will be going in the trash

I backed the LEAN from Raphael Quality Goods, have it for over 3 years now. I was just looking for a larger wallet, since I use a lot of cash now, but I will stick to it. It really has a better leather quality and stitches are still holding perfectly, maybe you should check that one out.

I'm not satisfied at all, but let's not dwell on this failed project. I hope Brandon uses the 20k profit he made on this project for something good. I' m not buying anything from Most Rad ever again and would advice everyone i meet to do the same.

Hello, sadly I all so disappointed and that not because of the design that is not like it was claimed in the project. THE BAD QUALITY is the problem, I have my most red no one week in use and I can not see that the durability corresponds with the price. Two sutures are open or loose and the material is falling apart at the edges. I will never buy a MOST PORE QUALITY and NOT LOVE TO ALL THE DETAILS again!

campaign.story:
Life Turning is a lateral zoetrope displaying Kansas City dance and is intended to be viewed by the riders of the Kansas City streetcar. A zoetrope is an animation toy developed prior to film animation. These toys create the illusion of movement through a rapid succession of images. The original zoetrope was designed using a cylindrical device where the viewer is stationary and the images are in motion. Later variations of the zoetrope evolved into the lateral zoetrope where the images become stationary and the viewer is in motion. The lateral zoetrope has been incorporated into the mass transit systems of multiple urban cities. The use of zoetropes in this manner creates a novel and exciting experience for the riders.  
Life Turning is the meaning of zoetrope in Greek. These words are a fitting description of the change underway right now in Kansas City, particularly in our downtown core. The objective of Life Turning is to connect the riders to an interactive experience and expose the riders to multiple mediums of artistic expression. In an effort to establish more of a connection with the people and artistic community in Kansas City, Life Turning utilizes video stills of local dancer, Cat Mahari.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Life Turning is currently installed on the Main St. bridge between downtown and the river market in Kansas City. There is a potential for this project to be expanded. Also, the current installation is temporary. There is a possibility for a permanent installation to be completed. This fundraising campaign is to help with the costs of the current installation and to assist in the possibility of an expansion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
No more plastic tubes. Good for you. Good for the planet.
The biggest ever breakthrough in the way we use toothpaste, Poppits softgel pods melt right in your mouth! We have eliminated the need for plastic tubes or pumps that create messes and gunky buildup over time. 
Not to mention, toothpaste tubes sit in our landfills for over 500 years before they decompose. Poppits packaging is 100% biodegradable- now that’s something to smile about!
Poppits comes in two varieties: Whitening Poppits™ for adults and Kids Poppits™
Each softgel pod is made of an edible plant-derived cellulose film that melts in the mouth. The toothpaste inside is fluoride-free and made from natural ingredients. There are no animal fats anywhere in our products.

Our future phases of manufacturing will include additional flavors and formulas including a natural fluoride version.
Poppits in the news:
    Sure, there are fun toothbrushes out there, but what about the actual toothpaste?
Kids love Poppits and the sensation of popping it in their mouth and the burst of fun fruity flavor. Poppits are a fun and easy way to get kids engaged in oral care.
Each Kids Poppits® box contains three fun fruity flavors; Sweet Strawberry, Green Apple and Merry Berry. 
Learning good oral hygiene as a kid carries over to adulthood. Poppits has the dentist-recommended amount of toothpaste in each pod, so kids learn the safe, effective amount they need to have healthy teeth.
    Traditional toothpaste tubes get sticky residue all over the sink or over the top of the tube when caps get lost. With Poppits, these messes are a thing of the past.
  It makes perfect sense. There’s no more squeezing that gunky toothpaste tube into the bristles of your brush! Effectively reducing cross-contamination, Poppits are the most hygienic way to get a healthy, pearly white smile.
  Breathe a breath of fresh air! Whitening Poppits come with 90 softgel pods. Each one contains fresh minty toothpaste sealed in a water-soluble whitening film to brighten your smile! 
It’s always hard to get that last bit of toothpaste from a rolled-up squeezed tube but with Poppits you get it all! Right down to the last fresh pod! 
Poppits are the perfect travel accessory because they are small, convenient and most importantly, meet TSA requirements for your carry-on luggage.
No more wrapping a toothpaste tube in a plastic bag and having it burst! 
  Poppits™ are bringing a revolutionary change to the way we brush our teeth. This is the biggest breakthrough ever in the toothpaste industry. No more plastic tubes! Good for you. Good for the planet. 
   Our custom-designed paperboard packaging is environmentally-friendly and biodegradable. By not using plastic toothpaste tubes you will be doing your part to reduce plastic pollution. You’re welcome mother nature! 
It is so cool! Cooler than Willy Wonka’s Chocolate Factory, we think! The manufacturing plant that produces Poppits also produces many other household consumer goods. 
Stay tuned! In the coming weeks, we’ll post a wee video in our updates to show you Poppits being made.
We are proud to partner with the most trusted manufacturers and suppliers in the USA to bring you the very best. Each time you use Poppits you will be supporting American jobs.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are passionate about bringing Poppits to households around the world and reducing plastic pollution. For the past few years, we've dedicated ourselves to developing prototypes, testing them, analyzing feedback, finalizing the design and completing all the engineering requirements necessary for production. 

We have partnered with an exceptional toothpaste company and manufacturing company to bring Poppits to life. The manufacturing process always presents challenges, however with our experienced team, we are confident we will overcome these challenges as they arise.

We are committed to an honest and transparent relationship with our supporters. In the event of unexpected issues, we promise to quickly communicate them and to work incessantly to meet the delivery dates.

campaign.story:
What is En Route?
En Route is a high suspense, quick playing, easy-to-learn board game for 2-4 players. At first glance En Route appears to be very light and simplistic. That is not true. This game has a level of suspense and energy only exceeded by social deduction games.
I have struggled to convey what makes this game interesting. This game is intense and creates a lot of suspense as you race to finish your objectives before the other players. Since the goals are hidden you don't know when your opponents will take take resources you need or even when someone else will win the game. I really love the energy of the game, I would like to convey that message to you, the viewers of this campaign.
This is a gateway game. You can play it with your non-gamer friends.
Pledge $1 for immediate access to the print-and-play
Easy to Learn, Easy to Play
En Route was designed to enjoy with your family and friends. It only takes a few minutes to learn and less than an hour to play. Yet it still requires strategy and engages players of all levels.
Rules
Download the instruction booklet to see the rules. All backers get immediate access to the print-and-play game. Which includes PDFs for the instruction booklet, game board, cards and tokens.
Here is a brief overview of the rules:
Place the board in the center of the table (I know all the podcasters out there love this rule. Ahem, Rolling Dice & Taking Names)
Players have a hand of 4 action cards and 3 goal cards. The hand is secret.
The goal is to deliver the 2 goods indicated on the goal card to the indicated city for each of your 3 goal cards.
The cards in hand can be played to move items from adjacent cities or to produce the good that city produces.
Up to three goods tokens can be moved when transiting between cities.
When a city has goods on it, it's considered open and you can move to it or produce its good without playing a card from your hand.
The goal card can be played as an action card, but beware if you play it before completing it you'll show your objective to your opponenets.
The goods are limited and the conflict becomes real when your opponent takes advantage of the pile of goods you are move toward your own goal.
Beautiful Components
 A lot of attention was given to the design and layout of the components. The cards are easy to read even when fanned out in your hands. The board is elegant and simple. The tokens are marked and easy to distinguish.
Game Play
Each player begins the game with three hidden goals. Players take turns playing cards to produce goods or move them between cities. As the game progresses the players will reveal their completed objectives. The game will keep you on the edge of your seat as you try to be the first to complete all three goals.
Components
We have received and tested several variations of components. All final components will be high quality and durable. The box and cards will have linen finish. The cards will be poker quality, ivory core cards. We continue to look for ways to improve the quality and experience of the game. We hope to upgrade the paperboard tokens to printed wooden tokens with our first stretch goal.
Development
En Route has already been prototyped, play tested and edited. The game play and mechanics are solid and the art is finished. We've enjoyed developing this game and playing it with our friends and family. We hope you have the chance to enjoy it as much as we have.
En Route has easy to understand instructions so it's easy to get going and start having fun.
Shipping
We are working with fulfillment companies to provide Canadian and European Union backers customs-free shipping. We know you don't want to pay extra customs or VAT and you won't have to.
Creators
En Route was created by Nathan and Jake Jenne. Both Jake and Nathan enjoy designing games together. They have spent many years working through various projects together and hope you'll enjoy this game as much as they have. Nathan and Jake sincerely appreciate your help.
Important Stuff
This game is friendly to the colorblind. We don't exclusively rely on colors to distinguish tokens, cards or placement. Additionally, the text is easy to read and high contrast.
We really focus on keeping our games family-friendly. This means we don't use questionable graphics. We don't use suggestive content. We keep the language clean and friendly. This doesn't mean we neuter the experience for adults or make games devoid of strategy. This simply means we want to reach the largest audience possible and we don't want you to be embarrassed when your kids, friends, parents, spouse walk into the room.
We strongly support women in gaming. Nothing we do will indicate otherwise.
Track this project on kicktraq
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest risks and challenges are the typical risks and challenges associated with sourcing and printing the game in volume and the logistics of delivery.

While we don't expect huge problems we are preparing contingency plans for some of the more common issues.

The biggest risk is delayed delivery. As you are probably aware many projects run into this problem. We are trying very hard to meet our projected dates. We want to meet all your expectations and enjoy this game as much as we have.

Jake has worked as a product developer in the crafting industry for several years. He has gone through the steps of sourcing and printing many times at multiple companies. He is experienced with both domestic and international vendors. Jake also brings to the table a lot of professional experience with order fulfillment, logistics and shipping. Jake has done everything from shipping out of his garage to shipping from warehouses and dealing with customers ranging from ma and pa shops to Amazon. 

Nathan, on the other hand, has more down-to-earth experience working the in shipping centers of two separate companies. He has hands on experience with volume shipping. He has plenty of experience fulfilling orders all night long and making airport runs before the crack of dawn.

We'll try our hardest to make sure this project succeeds on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
To my friends, family, fans, and anyone else reading this, Thank you! I'm excited to share my passion of art and poetry with you by Kickstarting my first book of poems and drawings - Underneath the Gooberry Bush! You can help us reach our goal by either pledging to my campaign or sharing it on social media. 
Warmly, 
Ken Higginson
Original Poems & Drawings by Ken Higginson!
Whether nonsensical, whimsical, charming, wistful, or a bit macabre, the poems and drawings in Underneath the Gooberry Bush echo with charm and fascination.  From unfamiliar adventures in faraway lands to the mystery of your own familiar sock drawer, each poem captures hearts and imaginations. 
Find out what it’s like to have a zombie for a best friend. Meet characters like Sleepwalking Tom, and Loud Mouth Sue. Visit Cambridge Court, where the men wear cats instead of hats. Find a rainbow in a bottle, watch Ted surf a crocodile, learn the magical uses of peanut butter, set sail on a moon boat, and so much more! 
Some samples just for you.
 Hungry Couch read by Ashley Higginson
 Honey Bear read by Eric Hollaway
What will we do with the money?
The money raised in our campaign will be used to purchase an ISBN and then pay for the printing and shipping of the book and bookmarks.
The book is already written, edited, illustrated, and ready for print. Once our funding goal is reached and the campaign ends, the file will be sent immediately to our printer. First they will print and send me a single copy to proof. After My final approval they will print and deliver the books to me and I will send them to you. The whole process after we fund will take at most a month. 
Pledge Levels
$24 BOOK - Receive a hardback copy of Underneath the Gooberry Bush and my sincere thanks for your support! 
If your local you may pick up your book, have it signed, eat cookies, and grab some free bookmarks at our book launch party - location, date, and time will be determined near end of campaign. Additional books can be purchased at the event. If you can't make it, we will ship the book to you.
$29 SIGNED BOOK & BOOKMARKS - Can't make it to the party but still want a signed copy? Receive a signed hardback copy of Underneath the Gooberry Bush, two book marks featuring art from the book, and my sincere thanks for your support! (of course the additional money is not for signing the book, it's for the double shipping - to me from the printer so I can sign it, then from me to you)
$48 - 2 BOOKS  - Receive a hardback copy of Underneath the Gooberry Bush and my sincere thanks for your support! + Have an additional copy shipped to you or sent to a friend, school, or library of your choice.
$58 - 2 SIGNED BOOKS & BOOKMARKS - Receive a signed hardback copy of Underneath the Gooberry Bush, two book marks featuring art from the book, and my sincere thanks for your support! + Have an additional signed copy and bookmarks shipped to you or sent to a friend, school, or library of your choice.
$72 - 3 BOOKS - Receive a hardback copy of Underneath the Gooberry Bush and my sincere thanks for your support! + Have TWO additional copies shipped to you or sent to friends, schools, or libraries of your choice.
$87 - 3 SIGNED BOOKS & BOOKMARKS - Receive a signed hardback copy of Underneath the Gooberry Bush, two book marks featuring art from the book, and my sincere thanks for your support! + Have an additional TWO signed copies and bookmarks shipped to you or sent to friends, schools, or libraries of your choice.
$96 - 4 BOOKS - Receive a hardback copy of Underneath the Gooberry Bush and my sincere thanks for your support! + Have THREE additional copies shipped to you or sent to friends, schools, or libraries of your choice.
$116 - 4 SIGNED BOOKS & BOOKMARKS - Receive a signed hardback copy of Underneath the Gooberry Bush, two book marks featuring art from the book, and my sincere thanks for your support! + Have an additional THREE signed copies and bookmarks shipped to you or sent to friends, schools, or libraries of your choice.
Childrens books, childrens book, art books, Art book, Children's books, Books, Poems, Poem book

We have received the books, boxes, bookmarks, etc. and will begin fulfillment right away. Most of your books will be on there way by this weekend. Those who's books are shipping direct from our printer will take an additional 1-3 days to ship. 
This journey has been a blast. I've been so amazed by the amount of support and encouragement  from all of you. Thank you again & Enjoy your books!

Just a quick update to let everyone know we received the advanced copy proof of our book and everything looked amazing! 
Well everything except one thing. Our original paper choice was a 50 pound cream. While those I showed it to in person seemed to think it was fine, I felt like the paper was a bit too yellow and thin. So in an effort to give you the best quality book possible we are changing to a 70 pound paper in a lighter shade of white. I've ordered a new proof which will get here on Wednesday.

Assuming everything looks good with the quality of the book when we get it, we will be ready to order your books as soon as kickstarter releases the campaign funds (in about ten days).

updates.update_userinfo: Thank You! What's the next step?
updates.update_content:
Our campaign to publish my new children's book Underneath the Gooberry Bush had a successful ending today. I cannot express how awesome it is to me that bringing this project to life was made possible by so many of my friends, family, and fans! Thank you.
So what happens next?
First, kickstarter will process the pledges and wire us the money (this actually takes about two weeks).

Poetry is fun to read out loud! This is something our family has done for years and we hope you'll give it a try. Here are just a few things you can try when reading poetry out loud:
Practice different character voices. Put on different tones or accents to see which ones sound the best. My kids like to do a British voice for some poems and a southern drawl for others. Try sad, happy, crazy or mad.

campaign.story:
Originally designed for our own in-house use, the newly redesigned Versa-Former 3D is a multi-purpose thermoforming system that vacuforms, slump-forms, and strip-heats, creating an unlimited variety of professional products.
Ideal for prototypes and short run productions, the Versa-Former 3D’s “one-man-band” functionality has made it a point of interest among:
Prototypers
Engineers
Product designers
Packaging designers
Prop makers
Special effects managers
Sculptors
and serious model builders
Producing larger parts than most personal 3D printers and accepting a greater range of plastics, the original Versa-Former 3D was the go-to model-forming system at our studio long before we decided to offer it to the public.
Research shows it to be the most affordable plug & play machine currently in production, and it has repeatedly proven to be capable of paying for its own cost in less than one project.
PLAY

Powered off of standard 120 V service, the steel-fabricated device features a foot switch allowing for hands-free operations and special effects, as well as a carrier that automatically remains in place the moment that the levers are released.
 Spring Loaded Levers
 Vacuum Control Foot Switch
 No heating plastics in the oven
 No external vacuum necessary
Professional quality machine - Not a toy!
ABS, styrene, polyethylene, polypropylene, butyrate, acetate, acrylic, polycarbonate, and PETG are all equally applicable to the system’s operation, which lends itself to a variety of clear, opaque, translucent, colored, or textured plastic sheet materials (16 x 16”), from paper-thin to 3/16” thick.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We realize that when launching a new company, some of the greatest challenges faced are those which are unforeseen. With that, here are some of the hurdles we identified:

-Funding of inventory- This is why we're here on Kickstarter!

-Sourcing of components- From vacuum motors to heaters. We've designed the Versa-Former 3D to meet very high standards. This means we're tirelessly searching for the very best parts and materials to use in the final production.

-Networking to get our message out- (DreamProjX-3D, LLC as a new manufacturing & marketing company of the Versa-Former 3D machines, we haven’t had much time to develop a following.) Please help us out and share this page with all your friends and colleagues!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Intrepid Camera Company was born out of a genuine fascination and love of large format photography, with our first product being the intrepid 4x5 camera.
The Intrepid 4x5 camera is a redesign of the traditional large format camera; these cameras have their origins at the very beginning of photography; pictures were made onto glass plates that required the sitter to stay still for minutes at a time. In the 1930s-50s they became the go-to camera for press photographers and artists, with American photographer Ansel Adams becoming a pioneer in landscape photography. 
Since then this branch of photography has defiantly continued to produce some of the most important and beautiful pictures ever created. It has resisted the digital revolution and continues to attract new, passionate photographers despite the technology being over 100 years old. This attraction is for one simple reason, large format photography is as far away from digital photography you could possibly get, there is 0% automation, your camera does not have a microchip for a brain. It has you. 
It is entirely pure photography and allows maximum creative freedom. The large format camera is a tool for art, not convenience. The images have warmth to them akin to the sound of a vinyl record, and a quality to them you just can’t quite put your finger on. So maybe it isn’t one simple reason, maybe I don’t really know exactly why these cameras are so special. I do however know they are manifestly important to the future of photography, and to us! 
So why redesign this ‘perfect’ camera? Well, we feel there is a need for an affordable non second hand camera that is simple to use, lightweight, compact, and most of all a great tool to get new photographers passionate about large format photography. This fantastic art form will only live on if people continue to discover and enjoy it. I hope the Intrepid Camera can help people do just that. 
Final camera will be made from high quality Birch Ply Wood milled using a CNC Router with Aluminium supports and hinges, so it will look slightly different to the one above. 
Ground Glass focusing screen that lets you compose and focus your image by moving the lens with the rack and pinion mechanism. 
Takes 75-300mm lenses in Linhof/Technika style lens boards.
Full movements on the front standard.
The design gives the camera excellent strength and rigidity, whilst keeping the weight low at around 1.2kg.
Compatible with standard film holders as well as the 405 and 545/545i (if funding is successful some of the funds are earmarked for the development of a Graflok back).
Choice of four bellows colours Black, Blue, Red and Green.
Standard Tripod mount
Portrait and landscape rotating back 
Please note the camera does not come with a lens, please see the lens buying guide bellow for help.
Camera folds down to 190mmx190mmx120mm.
Compact and light weight enough to not be a burden whilst out in the field.
4x5 is an amazing format. The film comes in sheets that are much larger than your standard 35mm- 13x larger in fact. This lends an incredible amount of clarity and depth in your images. The film would be considered "HDR" in the digital world due to the amount of detail it can capture. 4x5 film is still produced and readily available all over the world, with Ilford, Fuji and Kodak manufacturing some of the most high tech films that have ever existed.
 (Holding up a sheet of Fuji Velvia 50 on a light box)
 (Taken using the intrepid camera onto Fuji Provia 100f)
 (Taken using The Intrepid Camera onto Ilford HP5)
 (A 150% crop of an image taken onto Fuji Velvia 50)
We have kept the rewards simple; two products in a few different ways. However if there is something you would like to see or think we have missed, get in touch! 
It all helps! With this pledge you will be added to the mailing list, receive updates about the project as well as a credit on the website and we will be forever grateful!
PLAY

1x Photographer's Notebook. 
A B6 size notebook designed specifically for analogue photographers, so you can make notes in the field and darkroom.
2x Photographer's Notebooks. 
Two B6 size notebooks designed specifically for analogue photographers, so you can make notes in the field and darkroom.
Seeing as you got here early, (There are only 25 of these!)
Super Early Bird Intrepid Camera; the final production model of the camera at a special price for getting here first! 
Includes:
Intrepid 4x5 Camera 
Choice of Bellows Colour (Black, Red, Blue, Green)
Pinhole Lens (see update #3)
The final production model of the Intrepid 4x5 Camera,  
Includes:

Choice of Bellows Colour (Black, Red, Blue, Green)
Photographers Notebook
Pinhole Lens (see update #3)
Get One of the first cameras, before anyone else, with a personal engraving on the front. (see picture for example, could be your name or something special)
One of the first 10 Intrepid 4x5 Cameras with custom engraving on the camera, as well as a special mention on the website. The model number you receive will be on a first come first serve basis.
Includes:
Intrepid 4x5 Camera
Choice of Bellows Colour (Black, Red, Blue, Green)
Photographers Notebook
Custom engraving
Pinhole Lens (see update #3)
(one of the first prototypes...)
We have come a long way with the design of the camera since this project first started over a year ago, but to bring it to a stage where we can finally share it with you we need some help. If we are successful here it will allow us to set up the workshop and buy the equipment we need to produce the cameras economically. It will also allow us to develop new exciting products for the large format community, including products like an 8x10 camera and range of film holders. 
There is a vast quantity of lenses to choose from when it comes to 4x5 cameras, from 'swirly background producing' brass barrel lenses to tack sharp modern lenses. It would be foolish of us to try and talk about them all here, 
So check out these websites for information and prices.
Great place for used lenses https://www.keh.com
Great place for LF stuff (including lenses) http://www.catlabs.info/
This list is a little old so ignore the prices but it is very comprehensive http://www.largeformatphotography.info/lenses/LF4x5in.html
This list is a little more up to date, and features some other intersting info about large format lenses http://www.ebonycamera.com/articles/lenses.html
Main things to remember when buying are to make sure that:
The glass is clean and has no fungus.
The lens is in a shutter that does not stick and works well (accurate speeds etc).
The lens filter ring has no dents on it.
In all honesty you can't go far wrong getting any Schneider, Rodenstock, Fuji or Nikon Large format lens. As long as it is between 75-300mm, in good condition and mounted on a Linhof/Technika style lens board, it will be a fantastic place to start.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been working on the design for over a year now and will continue to do so as the Kick-starter runs. This being said there are elements of the design that can only realistically be tested once we have been funded; for example changing the support struts and hinges to aluminium instead of wood. 

The manufacturing method has been tested on a small scale, but obviously not on the scale that will be required if we are successful. However this has been very thoroughly worked out and we are confident it will scale up with no big problems.

As with all Kickstarter projects, customers are exposed to the process of product development and this has its risks attached. Saying that, we are fairly late on in the product development stage, which gives us slightly more confidence in when we can deliver this product. We feel that four months after receiving the Kickstarter funds is realistic.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone!
Great news, We have done it! all the cameras have been shipped and the waiting is over.
Thanks so much for all the patience and support you gave us over the last year, we had no idea it would take this long when we started this project but I hope that most of you would agree, the wait was worth it.

Hello Everyone!
First, great news the cameras are all done and are going out over the next 3 days, most of you will have them by the end of the week and this will bring us up to %100 of backers with cameras.
The Important bit now though is to make sure your address is correct, as it has taken a lot longer to do this that we initially anticipated, it is likely that some of you have moved, so please check your address and update it if you need to.

Hello everyone!
We were soooo close to shipping this week and then we discovered that there were some serious problems with this batch of ground glass and basically they all had to go in the bin. We found that the way the sharp edges had been rounded off made some tiny fractures and the glass was cracking when we put it into the camera. This was caused by something as simple as using the incorrect grinding belt and of course the problem has now been fixed. This is very frustrating as this is a labour intensive part and is going to take a couple of weeks for us to fix, I'm really sorry to let the few remaining backers down again, the cameras are essentially ready but without focusing screens they are not much use to you. The team is working long hours and weekends to make up the time so we should start to see cameras in the post before the end of September.

Hello everyone!
Just a quick update to say that things are running smoothly and we are on schedule to begin shipping the last of the cameras in the first week of September. This will bring us up to 100% shipped!
Thanks for your continued support!

Hello everyone,
Sorry this update has been such a long time coming, we wanted to finish shipping before we posted it so everyone would know if the update applied to them or not. 
So if you have received a camera or notification of shipping (to the email you used to sign up to Kickstarter) then congratulations! I'm really looking forward to what you lot get up to with your cameras, and remember we are all ways here if you need us for any advice or problems.

Hello Everyone,
a couple of weeks ago we finally got the last of the aluminium back from the anodisers and so begun a frantic assembly session.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #37 Friday Update (sorry it's been a while)
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone!
Sorry we haven't done one of these in a while
we have now shipped to 65% of backers and this next batch will bring us very close to 100%
over the last few weeks we have been settling in to our new workshop and getting things up and running again, this took a little longer than we wanted but things are so much faster in the new workshop that we hope to make up the lost time.

Hello Everyone!
Sorry it has been a couple of weeks since our last update, things have been busy as we move over to the new workshop and we ran out of time, we will try to be more proactive with them over the next few weeks as we get the final cameras out the door.
Over this weekend and the first few days of next week we will be shipping up to Backer #280 you can find your backer number by clicking the drop down menu in the top right of the page, selecting backed projects, select this project and your backer number is at the bottom of the pop up.

Hello everyone!
So another 50 are out the door!
We have spent most of this week doing initial assembly of the next batch of 100, and we have a couple of new team members that are speeding things up! The aluminium will be ready to attach at the end of next week and then we will ship them out the week after, so should be getting up to around backer 280 in 2 (ish) weeks, then just 2 more batches and we will have sent out all the Kickstarter and Pre-order cameras.

Hello everyone!
Just a quick one to let you know how it's all going, been a busy couple of weeks (as all ways) and we will be shipping up to backer 177 over the next few days. Look out for an email with tracking info and make sure your address is correct!
Work has all ready started on the next batch, we are ramping things up and building a batch of 100 over then next two weeks and hopefully shipping them all the week after. This will bring us over 50% shipped, a milestone we are all looking forward to!

campaign.story:
A portable, flexible monopod for your phone or GoPro with a super-powerful magnetic base? It's here!
"Selfies" was the word of the year in 2013. In 2014 let's all agree to  start taking selfies that don't look like selfies -- with the GripSnap! The GripSnap (patent pending) is AWESOME, whether you're taking a group photo with your friends or doing kickass GoPro videos from the hood of your car. There are so many uses for the GripSnap, you're going to need more drive space for all of your crazy photos! 
It's not just for iPhones!
The GripSnap works with smartphones of all shapes and sizes up to and including the Samsung Galaxy Note, which is 3.27" wide.
Stop asking people to take your picture, or worse, having a phone full of pictures without you in them! Finally, everyone can be in the photo -- just snap the GripSnap to pretty much any ferrous metal surface, and using one of many available camera timer apps, take pictures that include the whole crew, instead of always missing one person…
Snap your GripSnap to a bike rack
Snap the GripSnap to any ferrous metal surface...
Stretch Goal Added!!
If we reach the $25,000 mark, we're adding a new reward -- the GripSnap Car Mount! If you use your phone for navigation or if you want an easy dash-cam setup, you'll want this! See the prototype in the GripSnap Update #4 
To reach this goal, we're going to need your help spreading the word. Please share this project on social media to get the word out:
Share on Facebook
Share on Twitter
Share on Google +
PLAY

 A few other uses for the GripSnap in the video above…
Snap the GripSnap to a light pole for a quick selfie!
 How do you take a hands-free selfie?
It's easy! There are lots of camera timer apps out there. Some are even voice or sound activated, so you can clap your hands or yell "Cheese!" and your phone will take your picture. Here are a few of the apps we like that work GREAT with the GripSnap:
 Mounting your GoPro was never easier:
Snap your GoPro to any ferrous metal surface
The GripSnap works great and looks pretty cool too...
Snap your GripSnap to a water fountain...
Where will you snap your GripSnap?
Concepting the GripSnap on paper last year
 What's next?
I have manufactured and brought other products to market and my last big product landed me a spot on Shark Tank. But this is the coolest product I've developed, because it has so many uses. I'm psyched to get one into your hands!!
We want you to have your GripSnap as soon as possible. Here's the basic timeline we're looking at:
July/August: Meet lots of cool Kickstarters, continue work on mold and plastic encasement for the magnet.
September: Finalize the conduit type/source/size/length. Have our manufacturers crank out a bunch of our custom sized magnets and get them coated and shipped.
October: Shipping from the manufacturer ALWAYS takes longer than expected, so October is our target month to receive phone clips, production conduit and complete magnets.
November: Assembly and fulfillment. We've got a crazy schedule ahead of us, but we've been doing the footwork for the GripSnap for over a year. We're confident we can make our shipping goal.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have worked very hard to get the GripSnap ready for Kickstarter and full-scale manufacturing, but here are some challenges ahead:

MANUFACTURING: Due to the brittle nature of neodymium magnets, they have a tendency to shatter, which was a problem with our early prototypes. To ensure that this won't happen on the production models, we're working on a strong, but thin, plastic casing for our magnets. We've already got a manufacturer working on the mold and should have samples late this summer. We have confidence in our manufacturer to deliver a great final product, but we have a back-up manufacturer at the ready, should anything go sideways.

PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: As the GripSnap gets closer to production, we're going to continue to do some fine tuning, especially on the conduit tubing. Each generation of materials we try gets better and our current version has a high degree of flexibility, coupled with good rigidity. That said, we're going to be able to shorten it, making the GripSnap even more compact, while retaining the flexibility to bend the GripSnap into any position required. As we fine-tune the design, I'll definitely give updates and pictures showing how things evolve. This stuff is fun!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Follow us on: Case-Cam.com - Facebook - Twitter - Instagram 
The Basics:
CaseCam is the world's most compact mobile device tripod.
The app lets you take pictures remotely and preview your picture on a another mobile device before you take it.
You can then look at the shot you just took with the second device and retake it remotely if you didn't like it.
The app has an adjustable timer for taking pictures on your own.
You can also edit and share the photo with your favorite social media service directly from the CaseCam app.
CaseCam is the world’s most compact iPhone tripod and paired with the CaseCam app, it allows users to take pictures and video remotely using other IOS devices! 
The wifi viewfinder feature of the app even allows you to see what your CaseCam is seeing on the screen of another IOS device, enabling you to frame the picture you are taking while you are in it! This eliminates the need to have a separate photographer to take the picture for you so that everyone in your group can get #inthepicture.
Hello Kickstarter!
We are excited to be here with our first project. We invented CaseCam to enable users to get the very most out of their mobile devices.
The case and app were born out of a desire to be included in group photos of friends and family and to enhance the phone’s capacity for capturing hands-free pictures and videos. CaseCam solves a problem faced by students, moms, dads, travelers, video bloggers, and anyone who uses their phone to snap group photos or take video.
The scenario is very familiar. You are with a bunch of friends or family, in a special, memorable place and you want to capture that moment, but no one is around to ask, “Hey, can you take our photo?” So you, the photographer, get left out of the photo. CaseCam puts everyone back #inthepicture by eliminating the need for a photographer.
CaseCam also makes taking video much simpler, allowing you to set your phone on any surface and just press record. This allows users to record the moment without having to hold up their phone and watch it through their phone’s screen.
“I have a tripod with an iPhone attachment but never use it because it takes forever to set up and it’s a lot to carry around. CaseCam is a quick and easy solution to this problem. Now I can film my swing whenever and wherever.”
- Ryan Young, Golf Professional
-“It is a versatile and innovative product that helps capture images in so many practical situations. Taking Pictures with friends has never been easier.”
- Nick Schonewald, College Student
-Whenever I travel, it's almost impossible to take group photos without leaving someone out - usually myself. CaseCam makes it easy to take photos of my friends no matter where I go.
- Allie, Mullen, Student/Traveler
CaseCam uses a flip-out mirror kickstand to allow you to take pictures and video without having to hold up your phone. The mirror reflects the light into the iPhone camera and the kickstand clicks into the case when you don’t need it. It also works as a horizontal kickstand to prop up your phone for viewing videos.
The CaseCam App inverts the images and video that you capture so that they appear right-side-up again after being reflected off of the mirror. (And yes, it’s free.)
The app saves your pictures and video to your iphone’s camera roll so that your can edit them and share them like you normally would or you can share them directly from the CaseCam App!
The CaseCam App allows users to take group photos like never before, you can use it to:
Take pictures with an adjustable timer
Take pictures remotely by syncing with your friend’s IOS device, or your iPad.
The app’s innovative WiFi-viewfinder feature lets you use your friend’s iPhone to see what your CaseCam sees, so you can frame the photo while you are in it
Adjustable Timer.
Controlling CaseCam remotely.
Framing the picture while you are in it!
CaseCam is designed to be extremely low profile, but robust enough to protect your phone from wear and tear just like any other high quality protective cell phone case. It is made from impact-resistant injection-molded Polycarbonate — the same material used to make bullet-proof glass!
The case is also designed to look and feel great in your hand and your pocket, the slim design leaves lots of room for other items in your pocket, you may even forget that it’s there. The case leaves the buttons, audio port, and the thunderbolt port unobstructed so that any headphones or thunderbolt cable can plug in without needing to remove the case.
The mirror is made of optical quality Soda Lime glass with an extremely tight surface flatness tolerance so that your images will not be distorted at all and there is no perceivable loss in image quality. The mirror now stows toward the phone when it is not in use protecting the mirror from scratches
 Vote on additional CaseCam colors and phone models (please note that the images below were taken of a previous prototype):
https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/KQP3VLZ
Pink, Navy Blue, Deep Red, Teal-Gray
As you can see the CaseCam produces crisp, clear, undistorted images.
 *Note: KS lowers the quality of the images we have uploaded.
Every dollar helps as we try to bring CaseCam to life, thank you for your support!
Welcome earlybirds! Never be left out of the picture again with your very own CaseCam! This case is compatible with both the iPhone 5 and 5S. 
[Retail Value - $40] Add $25 USD to ship outside the US.
Never be left out of the picture again with your very own CaseCam! This case is compatible with both the iPhone 5 and 5S. 
[Retail Value - $40] Add $25 USD to ship outside the US.
Get a CaseCam for you and three of your friends! This is the best value we will ever offer, so get you and your friends #inthepicture with CaseCam. Compatible with both the iPhone 5 and 5s. 
[Retail value - $160] Add $25 USD to ship outside the US.
I am very happily married to my beautiful wife, Miriam. We live in Kirkland and two kids Gia (6) and Rocco (4). I currently work as a Managing Real Estate Broker at a small real estate office in downtown Kirkland, WA. We have been thinking for years about how a product like CaseCam would improve the day-to-day lives of other parents like us.
Last year I was looking across the sea of parents sitting on bleachers watching their kids in the preschool holiday show. It seemed like every 3rd parent was, like me, unsuccessfully trying to control their wobbling iPhone camera in their hand while their elbow was uncomfortably propped up on their knee. CaseCam's retractable mobile stand would enable all those parents to shoot better, more stable videos while actually being able to watch firsthand and enjoy the show.
We love taking our kids on adventures and vacations. Looking back through the photo album there was only one parent, either my wife or myself, in every family photo. It's just too inconvenient to find a trustworthy impromptu photographer at the beach, zoo or Disneyland that has the patience to frame the shot the way you want. I'm excited to immeasurably improve the quality of the family photos for myself and others when out together having fun.
With CaseCam's Bluetooth pairing and screen sharing, our photos will always look the way we want and with everyone included in the picture. We want our kids and our grandkids to look back at these photos and see that we were all there together.
- Justin Cicero, CaseCam Co-Founder
Garett Ochs – Mechanical Engineer & Entrepreneur

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Producing high quality products is never easy, but we are confident in our abilities to deliver this project on time and up to the stringent standards for quality that we demand at CaseCam. Our previous experience in manufacturing spacecraft, race cars, as well as the relationships that we have developed with our suppliers will help us mitigate unforeseen challenges that we may encounter during the production process. 

Keep in mind there are always issues that can arise, such as having to run multiple iterations during the injection molding tooling process, or being out of key components that delay our schedule.

Despite all of this, our target delivery date is December, 2014. We would love to ship earlier and we will do everything we can to make this happen. We are committed to making Cases that are fantastic both in form and quality.

We have our suppliers ready to go and with your support we can make this dream come true.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
This kickstarter allows you to turn your phone into a handheld microscope for only $8!
http://kck.st/1ULuouY

Good Afternoon Everyone!
 We hope you all had an excellent thanksgiving and are enjoying spending time with family and friends. We have taken some big steps in the production of the parts required for the mechanical side of the case and are underway with the development of the app.
 We produced over 13 different prototypes of the case assembly using Polyjet and SLA 3D printing technology and after months of trial and error we have converged on the geometry that we are having produced and cut out of P20 Tooling Steel. This mold will be formed using Electric Discharge Machining techniques like the one explained in this video:

Good Afternoon Kickstarters!
We have been making great strides to ensure that the first CaseCam that we put into people's hands is up to our high standards of quality. Since the conceptual design changes that we announced during the kickstarter we have created 8 different HD 3D printed versions of the case and we are now working on the final details of the design prior to creating tooling for the final injection molded parts that you will be receiving!

Hello Backers!
We are very happy to announce that we have made some significant design improvements to CaseCam. The most notable change to the design is that the mirror is now stowed toward the phone to protect the mirror from scratches while not in use! Also, the mirror is recessed to keep it from touching the back of the iPhone when it is stowed.

We are still shaking our heads. We broke $10K in funding today and currently have 218 backers! Your outpour of support has been incredible. 
The number of incoming emails, comments, and messages has been non-stop. We are extremely excited to have been featured by some very prominent media outlets over the past couple of days, we are extremely happy to see that the world is excited about CaseCam! 
Check out CaseCam in the media:

Wow! We have over 150 backers already and $7000 in funding toward our goal! 
We are incredibly grateful. 
The response over that last few days have been very humbling and we are amazed at how well CaseCam has been received! You support is incredibly important to us and we can’t wait to bring this product to the masses!

campaign.story:
I want you to draw. 
My name is Ray Sumser and I'm a life long artist. Kickstarter has shown me the joy of including others in my process and the possibility of inspiring others to create.
Back this project I'll add your art into a massive collaborative drawing. 
You could draw anything: yourself, a friend, a character you made up, a hat, a centipede, a heart, a roller-skate - - anything. Let's try to keep it kid friendly.
All drawing levels are acceptable. It will be especially cool to place budding artists next to the accomplished. 
My dream is to have as many collaborators as possible. Think WORLD RECORD status.  I don't know if that's possible, but if we go far enough I'll find out.
Get drawing!
As of 12pm EST, July 17:
 SEND IN YOUR ART!

campaign.story:
cFlekt with gold Exciter Technology™ insert
Flekt is all about the quality of light, and gives you studio-quality lighting from your pop-up flash - something that has NEVER been done before.
No matter if you're an aspiring photographer or semi-pro, Flekt gives you the perfect light to create professional-style photos.
cFlekt with silver Exciter Technology™ insert
From portraits to products, expand your creativity with beautiful, inspiring photos unlike anything you've ever captured. 
cFlekt with Lambertian White™ insert
Flekt attaches to your DSLR camera's hot-shoe, and redirects the light from the pop-up flash 180 degrees back into whichever attachment is on your system. 
No hassle or tricky equipment, just a simple and creative way to shoot beautiful and professional quality photos with your subject looking their best.  Choose your insert, shape the light and be creative!
Flekt helps put the fun back in photography!
TOP: cFlekt with Lambertian White™ insert, MIDDLE: cFlekt with silver Exciter Technology™ insert, BOTTOM: cFlekt with gold Exciter Technology™ insert
If you love the feeling of looking at the world through a DSLR lens, then Flekt is for you. From hobbyists to semi-pros to aspiring photographers, Flekt helps you take your photography to the next level. 
When you love photography like we do, why settle for good when you have the power to be great. Until Flekt, there wasn't a camera accessory that gave you high quality light for affordable prices. 
Natural light in the room vs. Flekt lighting
Now you can forget fancy and expensive equipment because Flekt gives anyone who loves photography the power to create professional photos. Whether you're in a studio shooting products, at home with the family or on location capturing an indoor or nightime wedding, bring out the inner pro-photographer in you by getting lost in the fun, inspiring and creative world of your very own photo shoot. 
iPhone - natural light
DSLR - cFlekt with silver Exciter Technology™
We weren't kidding when we said Flekt was simple and hassle-free. With just THREE parts to the Flekt system, it's easy to create high-quality lighting:
Simply slip the magAttach into your hot-shoe, lock it down and you're ready to go - it's that easy. It's called magAttach because all attachments connect with magnets to allow fluid pivoting to direct light onto your subject.
Flekt's ignitor reflector attaches to the front of the magAttach and redirects the light from the pop-up flash 180 degrees back into whichever attachment is on your system. Designed after a right-angle prism, but with concave reflectors, it is an efficient way to redirect light without losing it. 
We've created the first attachment and we call it cFlekt. The c stands for concave because we designed it around a modified concave reflection principle.  It attaches magnetically to the magAttach and can utilize white, silver and gold removable reflectors.  We are open to any user designing new, exciting attachments for the photography community.
Our attachments magnetically grip to the magAttach, and have fluid movement to add soft light to your subject.  Use the wall, use the ceiling, anything you can dream of to help you create the photo you want!  With each of the systems, you can have multiple texture and color choices to enhance and change your light. 
Our first inserts will be white, gold and silver.  Choose gold to warm when shooting against the sun, or choose silver with high contrast to kick up the specular highlights for fashion.  Additional inserts will come in the future as well as any other surface and color we can all think of!!
These attachments help you create high-quality photos without the hassle or expense of professional equipment.  Simply use the Flekt System with your DSLR to capture beautiful, inspiring pictures that you're extremely proud to call your own.
Because we reflect light, we have the opportunity to shape photons in ways that no other product can do. Imagine nano-structured fresnels, retroreflective focusing elements, colors, anything is possible. Our first two coatings will be Lambertian White™ and silver/gold metals with Exciter Technology™ enhancement.
cFlekt with Lambertian White™ insert
cFlekt with silver Exciter Technology™ insert
cFlekt with gold Exciter Technology™ insert
cFlekt with Lambertian White™ insert
cFlekt with Lambertian White™ insert
As a photographer, I got to a point where I wanted to start taking better photographs, so I got into studio photography. One of the products I used to rent all the time was a beauty dish - it was consistently the best form of light I got, so I started wondering if I could create the same quality of lighting from the pop up flash. That's when I met with Impact Design Associates and we got started working on a prototype.
We came up with several different design concepts, ensuring we exercised both visual and functional ideas.
Once we had our first working prototype, we sent out a bunch of photographers for some beta testing. Using all of their feedback and data, we were able to refine the product even more.
We've been designing and refining Flekt for 7 years now but we haven't had the funds to bring it to market - tooling and production can be very costly. So, we turned to Kickstarter because we feel that what we're offering is mutually beneficial - you support our project and help us raise the funds we need to produce Flekt.  It's a win-win, right? 
The quote from our manufacturer has given us a number we are comfortable with considering our Kickstarter funding goal. We are considering a minimum of 1,000 units - the lead time for 1,000 units is 6 weeks and for 50,000, it's 3 months. We tried to reflect maximum delivery time in our promises to deliver and want to keep a realistic view of over-estimating, not over-promising. We will, of course, keep our backers informed along the way, and will be working to save time anywhere we can without compromising the quality of the product. Flekt is a long-term product with global reach and we want to keep our customers happy for the long term.   

In terms of shipping and fulfillment, we will use Amazon FBA MCF and Fulfillrite. Fulfillrite will be our kitting facility where the coated reflectors and final Flekt units will be boxed and shipped. Logistics for time frame of arrival of these elements are still being figured out, but we will advise as they get dialed in. For international customers we will ship using USPS, UPS, and FedEx.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk for this product is reaching 100% universal camera compliance. I just don't have the funds to test it on every camera and we did the best we could to allow for universality. 

The main challenge for us is to get the orders out on time and keep our customers happy. My years as a producer offer me a unique set of skills to complete projects on time and on budget.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
Happy New Year!
This backer update has been a little late because I have taken a short vacation for the first time in two years to celebrate the milestone we achieved and release some stress.

Hi Backers,
I wanted to give you an update on the Flekt production prototypes.
After settling on a vendor to make our urethane casting production prototypes, we are proud to announce that we have received them and overall really like the quality. When we opened the box, we were thrilled to look at the parts and finally see the subtle textures and details we had been working toward. We placed most of the parts on a table and just stood there for a few minutes taking it all in.

Hi Backers,
What a ride the past few months have been for us. There have been highs, lows and everything in between. The amount of sweat and tears we have poured into Flekt, making it the best product it can be, is astounding. But most importantly, we are so proud of what we have accomplished!

Hi Backers!
It has been a particularly busy time at my day job over the past couple months, but that hasn’t stopped me from working early mornings, late nights and weekends to keep pushing forward with Flekt. It isn’t always easy to continue working after a 12 or 14 hour day, but I continue to be so excited about Flekt and can’t wait until you can experience it, that I find the motivation and desire to push myself to get it done.

Hi Backers!
We are progressing nicely with our detailed and (to be honest) grinding work of preparing each individual component for manufacturing. We are testing each slide, cam lock, groove, latch, etc. for durability, fit, function, amount of friction, ease of use and more.
We’ve found a couple points that are not quite up to snuff, so we are adjusting as needed. At this point, each change is so “minor” in scale. However, the precision needed for the fun, quick and easy use of Flekt for creative photography necessitates these changes, which will be “major” to you when in the heat of the moment. Most of these changes are a matter of a fraction of a millimeter, but affect the overall stability and the core structure of the entire system.

Hi Backers,
March was a good month for Flekt, and we made some solid progress! At this point, we are mostly going through the laborious process of dotting our i’s and crossing our t’s, trying to make sure that we have everything fully set for manufacturing. As each part goes through this process, we are getting the 3D CAD files ready, along with some very detailed part design drawings that include incredibly specific callouts. The part design drawings are so beautiful and contain so much detail. I think they reflect well on all of the months of hard engineering work.

Hi Backers,
It’s been a productive month since our last update. I have personally had more time to deal with major issues regarding Flekt and am glad to say that solid progress is being made. I am liking the current momentum and will strive to maintain it to get Flekt into your hands.
Since our last update, we have made two sets of fit and function prototypes to test design modifications. We made an exciting change that we think you’ll really enjoy. Once we received and played with the fit and function prototypes, as well as our CNC machined test prime reflectors, we realized that the friction method we settled on to hold our prime reflectors in place may wear out over time causing the reflector to fall out. One early prototype we created had a magnet system to hold the reflectors in place, so we took that and implemented a new magnet concept into our current engineering and we are proud to say, it rocks! Now the reflectors seat firmly and have a satisfying “click” when the prime reflector locks into place, and a similarly satisfying separation of the magnets when taking it out!

Hi Backers,
It’s been a couple months since we last posted an update, and I am sorry about that. I want to assure you that we have been busy, pushing forward with the singular goal of getting Flekt to you while keeping the quality and usability of the product at a high level.
Even after months and months of conversations and quotes in pre-production before Kickstarter, we were never told about the engineering process. Once we funded on Kickstarter and then subsequently discovered this, it took us over half a year to complete the detailed engineering work. Because of this obstacle, we have crafted Flekt into a much more refined and more usable product.

Hi Backers,
I want to sincerely apologize for how long this is taking. This process is difficult to do when you work ten hours a day at a job that helps to pay for Flekt. There are a lot of unforeseen processes and expenses that we didn't know about. This whole project is still being worked on by just two people.

Hi Backers,
Shortly before we were about to pull the trigger on mold creation for Flekt, we took a step back and looked everything over one last time. While we were super happy with the design revisions and engineering work done on most of the parts, we were not happy with the industrial design of the front reflector. We had a feeling that we could do better. Before we would let engineering release for molds we decided to put more time into the refinement of the front reflector.

I don't care who gets butt hurt over what I'm about to say, but given my horrible experience with crowdfunding sites, I'm not going to continue supporting these kinds of projects. If these creators can't get genuine investors to sacrifice for the possibility of launching a successful venture, then maybe their product/business is not as viable as they thought it was. Most people who back these projects are not wealthy, business minded investors looking to make money from a product. Most of us are just average working people, using our disposable income to fund projects that we feel are worth the little extra we have available. But it's seeming like more and more frequently, that these projects, are turning out to be the pipe dreams of those who couldn't otherwise procure the proper funding. So as much as I'd like to believe in what the people on these sites are putting forth, experience has taught me, that I should wait until these products hit the mass market if they ever do. I'd rather spend a little more later, and walk away with a working product in hand, than to put money up for something now, and potentially wait years for something that may no longer hold my interest by the time I receive it.
