campaign.story:
LESS THAN 24hrs TO GO. It's not too late to support us or pick up some wonderful rewards. :D
Inspired by the 1930’s Golden Age of Animation, the Animation Dock is an animation desk for artists who love both the past and the future. Based on the classic design of a traditional animation desk, this universal tablet dock takes style cues from the Art Deco and Streamline Moderne art movements of the time.
The Animation Dock is an animation desk designed for your iPad.
 Featured Backer Reward: The MiniDesk
 LATEST UPDATES (New to Old): 
NEW VIDEO showing in-depth look at our rewards
FREE KEYCHAINS now with every Animation Dock!
Press Kit is now available
Kickstarter Page Redesign! Since we're funded now, we want to focus on more details and current progress 
Lightbox: In-Depth Look with Videos and Details
Stretch Goals are now live! Learn more about them.
Our goofy Kickstarter Video is up! Enjoy!
NOTE: I'm doing my best to answer messages & questions as fast as I can. For live updates on what I'm working on at any given moment, follow us on Twitter. Thank you for being patient! :D 
Not only can you use the Animation Dock to rotate your digital canvas while working, but you can also use your tablet as a lightbox for tracing, animating, painting, and more. Each dock can be used with traditional paper animation thanks to the integrated Acme pegbar.
Support for 7" and 10" sized tablets (Only the iPad confirmed at the moment) 
Built-in industry standard ACME pegbar 
360 degree rotating disc  
Lightbox protective cover
Two parts: Base & removable Desktop (for upgrading, customizing, couch drawing)
Easy to use Lightbox app (iPad only for now)
Built in Burbank, CA
Lightbox is a straight-forward, easy to use app that let's you use your iPad as a light source.
Adjust your screen brightness
Set custom rulers/grids
Import an image
Adjust size, position, and opacity of your image
Use image and grid options together
 >>In-Depth Look at Lightbox (with videos & details)
Where Does the Funding Go?
Bulk ordering our supplies & materials - Wood, acrylic, caffeine
3D Printer - Rapid prototyping (Makerbot Replicator - ~$2100)
Final universal holder prototyping - ~1 month of R&D and testing
Purchasing a CNC Machine - For more sizes & material choices (Shapeoko 2 - $299)
Renting a workspace - The bigger the production run, the more we need a workspace larger than our tiny apartment (~$1000/month if we're lucky.)
Where Does Stretch Goal Funding Go?
- Better CNC tools (Plasma cutter?)
- Better 3D printer (Makerbot z18 w larger build area)
- Additional months of rent at a month-to-month workshop rental
- Larger bulk order of materials for future production runs
- Paying our app developer back for his donated time
- Labor costs for the production run team/volunteers
- Financial freedom to release more of our project as open source for fellow makers
- Safety net to begin our larger road map for upgrades, Cintiq support, full-size 16f disc versions, and more
$11,000 - NEW STAIN COLOR. Backers will now have two color choices for Mini-Desks and Animation Docks.  
$12,000 - FREE KEYCHAINS. Free wood-engraved animation disk keychains will be included with every Animation Dock ordered.  
$13,000 - NEW STAIN COLOR. Backers will now have three color choices for Mini-Desks and Animation Docks.  
$14,000 - NEW STAIN COLOR BY BACKERS. Our backers will be able to vote for a new stain color of their choice, allowing backers to have four color choices for Mini-Desks and Animation Docks.  
$15,000 - FREE LIGHTBOX APP. We'll make our Animation Desk companion iOS app, Lightbox, available for free on the App store. Lightbox is an easy to use app that allows you to use your tablet as a light box to trace photos, load a background image for your paper drawing, use a grid for guidance, and more.
$20,000 - CUSTOM SIGNATURE EDITIONS. Add YOUR own signature on a small plaque to your own Animation Dock. (Only available via Kickstarter!) Backers will be required to send in a clear scan of their signature (drawn with a Sharpie on paper) via e-mail in order for us to be able to engrave it clearly.  
$25,000 - INK N PAINT UPGRADE. A new color set will be available to choose from AND you'll have to option to choose between magnets or wearable charm set options.  
$30,000 - FREE INK N PAINT SET. Free greyscale set will be available with every Animation Dock.  
$40,000 - DESIGN A TWO COLOR DOCK. Backers will be able to vote to create one custom Animation Dock edition that will be available to all as a new Reward tier. Both wood AND Acrylic colors will be customization.  
$45,000 - FREE INK N PAINT COLOR SET. Free color set with every Animation Dock  
$50,000 - NEW GOLDEN MINI-DESK REWARD. Special Limited Edition Golden Painted Mini Desk with built in LED light and special Ink n Paint set. 
$60,000 - FREE STORYBOARD APP. Free copy of our upcoming iOS app for all Animation Dock orders. Bring your stories to life with an app designed to create and share movie and animation storyboards.
Where Are We Now?
This is our current working prototype, built specifically for the iPad Mini for our own testing (note: This version pictured does not have the universal holder).  
We have mockups, designs, and rough physical prototypes for a universal holder to accommodate other tablets, but we're still finalizing the design. This is where we could use Time and Money: 
If funded, we want to use our Kickstarter funds to purchase a 3D printer so we can more rapidly prototype some different ideas and parts for the universal support feature, as well as future add-ons for the dock. Corey has the 3D skills to be able to perfectly utilitize this tech to make our ideas into reality. Once the part is finalized, we can quickly mass produce and implement it into all the models.
.
Production Plan
The production will be handled here in Burbank, California by ourselves in collaboration with a local laser-cutting workshop.
Currently, we're building all of our test models out of a 500 sq. ft. apartment and driving our neighbors crazy with power tools in our storage space (complete with 100ft extension cable haphazardly strewn about the lawn).
If we're funded, we'll be renting out a small industrial workspace for our tools and assembly process. We'll need to store a lot of lumber, woodstain and painting materials, and power tools in order to get this wacky thing off the ground. Fortunately, we already have a few places lined up and ready to go.
Initially, we'll have a crew of 4 people building the docks. If we receive (squee) overwhelming support, we'll give ourselves high-fives all around, and hire on additional help to complete the orders. Fortunately, we have worked out a process that should allow us to get quite a few of these made quickly and efficiently, so our manpower needs will be relatively low.
Rewards
Minidesks
» Paintings from My Cat ($1)Exactly what it says. You will get a digital iPad painting by my cat. Don’t worry– She’s right here in Burbank, so it’s not more rampant outsourcing.
» Wood Animation Disc Keychains ($5)
Because there’s nothing like carrying some good hardware in your pocket.
» Ink n’ Paint Jar Magnets/Keychains ($15)
Hand-painted by your favorite Ink ‘n Paint ‘n Cat Lady with honest-to-goodness cel-vinyl animation paint
» Mini Traditional Animation Desks ($25)
 Man-made, cat tested. Add a little light underneath to make the world’s tiniest light box. What is this, a drafting desk for ants?!
» Animation Dock for Early Adopters ($100)
Get a limited edition, fully hand-made and finished Animation Dock of your own!

» Animation Dock ($175) Includes free shipping and keychain. Get a fully hand-made and finished Animation Dock of your own!
» Limited 1st Run Custom Editions ($250)
Choose your own adventure. Pick your wood stain color, trim color and additional details such as custom engraving.
» Stretch Goals?
If we reach stretch goals, we’ll be happy to offer additional colors, deluxe models and finishes, and more special features. More funding means better tools
Why Kickstarter?
We've been working on this by ourselves for months. We love the product. We created it because we want to have one on each of our desks. However, we need to establish that there's a market for this thing.
We're animators and designers. We've done game design, programming, studied Arduino, worked in stereography, and generally just attacked whatever we decide is the next thing we want to do. In short, we're detail-oriented control freaks... in a good way. We want to make something great, the right way, and for the right cost.
Frankly, we don't have a huge savings account, and we don't think we need one because we have plans to keep our overhead low. We don't want to involve investors, simply because we can't afford to lose any percentage of control over this thing to someone who won't understand why we're making this and why we don't want to overcharge everyone for it. We're perfectionists and weirdoes, and we'd like to think we know exactly where these products can go.
That's where Kickstarter comes in. For one thing, you all can help us prove that there's still a market for this kind of thing. There's something beautiful about hand-drawn animation, and we think we're not the only ones who see it and still get excited about it.
Secondly, having the money up front allows us to really push our production into full swing. We're going to need a reasonable amount of money to buy the bulk materials, rent the buliding space, and pay any helping hands we may need along the way.
Lastly, we believe this has the potential to be the beginning of something great. We're not looking for a pile of money to run off into the sunset with. We have plans, designs, and a pile of ideas sitting on hold at the moment, waiting for their time to shine. Some of these are features we'd like to develop and eventually add to the dock's functionality. Some of them are still animation-related but entirely different products altogether. If this thing manages to take off, you'd better believe that money will going straight back into new products for animation lovers everywhere.
Who Are We
We are a couple of animation nerds. We watch documentaries about the multi-plane camera and argue about whether or not something we're watching is rotoscoped. Animation and its history has always played a large role in forming who we are as both humans and artists. We like to take our love for animation and art and share it with our friends, and we always geek out out on things like old animation desks and art supplies. If you're interested in more specific information about us, here's a quick breakdown of our two project leaders.  
Corey & Tammy

Tammy Smith is a native Floridian who grew up with an above-average dose of the Disney channel and the Walt Disney World theme parks. Thanks to her family, she always had a strong background in science, arts, history, and sassy lady-ness. A winner of Terrible Timing, she made it to college just at the 2D animation programs were shelved. Ever since graduating from UCF as a Digital Media major, she has never stopped advancing her education on her own. She is a self-taught Illustrator, web designer, animator, model builder, & cat-enthusiast, and has more Twitter followers than her husband can understand.  
Technical background with 14+ years experience in IT including web, app, game design, & UI/UX
Artist & Producer - Experience running & supporting creative events, conventions, & more
Hobby Collector - Never afraid to teach herself a new skill to achieve a goal
  Corey Smith is a country boy from Southern Illinois. He went to school for digital animation and spends most of his time working in the VFX industry. He lends some construction experience and power tool knowhow to the mix, having worked on two Habitat for Humanity projects, as well as building his parents' home in Southern Illinois. Whenever Tammy dreams up an idea, he provides a functioning 3D model of it. He also likes coffee, waffles, and pie.
VFX stereo-conversion vet with credits like The Avengers & Star Trek Into Darkness
3D generalist - Modeling, Texturing, Animating, & more
Voice actor & general film production guy
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While we are veteran artists, we don't claim to be product designers. One thing we've been lacking is solid input from experienced veterans regarding product design, manufacturing, package design, and shipping/storage methods.

None of that is going to stop us, of course. We've spent buckets and buckets of time doing research in any fields that we're lacking in. We feel like we've settled on an excellent design that's easy to reproduce, even if we have to build them in our garage. 

It is conceivable (and likely) that we'll run into some sort of trouble along the way in one of these areas. However, six months ago, we'd never used a laser cutter before. Today, we have a slew of product templates designed for laser printing, and a pile of beautiful laser-cut desktops. This is the natural order of things for us, and we tend to find a way.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Stretch Goal: $30,000
Join us in getting the word out about his historic icon!
At $15,000 I will be able to acquire new equipment to edit this project faster and at a highest quality. I will also be able to acquire licencing for a variety of image libraries that were previously out of my price range.
At $20,000 I will be able to do the above while being able to access even more film & photo archival libraries that are otherwise out of my budget. This will also afford me the ability to hire a composer to produce an original score for the film and I can hire a sound and color correction engineers to master the entire production.
At $30,000 I will be able to do all of the above, while having the appropriate funds allocated to effectively distribute this film. I will be able to meet the necessary post production requirements for public television distribution and I will be able to facilitate more screenings in the NY Metro area as well as around the country.
Please continue to share this project so we can meet our Stretch goal! http://kck.st/LVOLWu
And come join our facebook group at People For the New York State Pavilion
Thanks so much!
For more on the Reach Goal, read update #2.
The New York State Pavilion, once the shining symbol of the 1964-65 New York World’s Fair, now sits as a haunting reminder of what became of the age of optimism that was the 1960s. This film tells the story of Philip Johnson's New York State Pavilion during the glory days of the fair, and chronicles its demise over the past 50 years. The film details its post-fair use as a 60s concert venue and 70s roller rink, including the years of neglect and the recent growing advocacy efforts to save and repurpose the structure.
Present day- Photo by Marco Catini
To learn more about who took this "Present Day" picture, check out Update #3.
MODERN RUIN: A World's Fair Pavilion documents what this iconic structure symbolized at the 1964-65 World’s Fair, and preserves many of the fascinating stories that are woven into the fabric of the building’s history. Few people remember that in 1969, some of the greatest musicians of the 20th century - The Grateful Dead, Led Zeppelin, Fleetwood Mac, Santana and many others - played in a summer concert series inside the Pavilion’s Tent Of Tomorrow. 
Circa 1964
By the early 70's, it had already been neglected for almost a decade when a young couple from Cleveland came upon it and decided to turn the building into a roller skating rink.  By 1975, as the city spiraled into economic crisis, they were kicked out and Philip Johnson's pavilion was left virtually untouched for almost 40 years. 
Mitch Silverstein & John Piro (The Painters of the Pavilion)
In 2009 a group of fair goers, led by John Piro and Mitch Silverstein, decided to take matters in their own hands by sprucing up the Pavilion with a fresh coat of paint.  This has helped to spark national interest in the New York State Pavilion, as well as a desire to develop an adaptive reuse for the structure. 
The Vintage Robot T-Shirt
Phil Buehler is a huge fan of modern ruins and the New York State Pavilion.  He is already a backer of this project and as an additional gesture of support, he has offered up his photography as a limited, last minute, stretch goal reward.  
Phil is an accomplished photographer who is fascinated by urban decay.  You can learn more about his work by visiting his website www.modern-ruins.com.
Photo by Phil Buehler
Photo by Phil Buehler
Photo by Phil Buehler
Scale Model of the NYS Pavilion 1:1600 or 1"=50'
Scale Model of the General Motors Pavilion
In order to bring this project to you in the greatest quality possible, I need your support.  Even a small contribution will go a long way in making this project great.  
The film is already in post production but I need this funding to secure the necessary post production processing of the final cut, to bring you the best film possible.  This includes acquiring music and archival footage/photographs, image licensing, audio mastering, and DVD replication and packaging.  
Since February of 2013 I have conducted almost 2 dozen interviews with authors, historians, architects, architectural critics, fair goers, post-fair concert goers, the operators of the roller skating rink and many more interesting individuals. I have traveled across the country and criss-crossed the New York Metropolitan area documenting their experiences in an effort to preserve the rich story of this visible ruin.
Working on this film has been an incredible experience due largely to the overwhelming support I have received over the past year.  The film is truly the product of a community effort and the generosity of many who are passionate about learning more about this building and seeing it put back to good use.
People have donated money, time, photos, home movies, and so much more to help this film become a success.
Any amount you can contribute is greatly appreciated, and by backing this project, you are making a statement about how you feel about the historical and future importance of the New York State Pavilion.
Check out the rewards in the panel to the right, and consider becoming a backer of this project.  Thanks!

updates.update_content:
WORLD PREMIERE! “MODERN RUIN: A WORLD’S FAIR PAVILION” 
Queens, NY (March 16, 2015) - AquaRela Pictures, is excited to announce the release of the much anticipated documentary Modern Ruin: A World’s Fair Pavilion, which will premiere at the Queens Theatre In the Park of Friday, May 22nd, 2015. Modern Ruin tells the story of Philip Johnson's New York State Pavilion during the glory days of the fair, and chronicles its demise over the past 50 years. The film details its post-fair use as a 60s concert venue and 70s roller rink, including the years of neglect as well as the recent advocacy efforts to save and repurpose the structure. Mainspring Pictures Ltd Presents, an Aquarela Pictures Production, in association with People for the Pavilion “Modern Ruin: A World’s Fair Pavilion”. Written, directed, and edited by Matthew Silva. Executive producers, Jake Gorst and Tracey Rennie Gorst.

Hey guys.  A year ago today my kickstarter was funded!  And two years ago today, production started for this film. 
Check out my latest blogpost at http://nyspavilion.blogspot.com/ and trace back to where this whole project started.

Hello Everyone,
Thank you all for waiting so patiently for an update as I finalize the documentary and work on post-production necessities. I'm really excited to share that a final cut of the documentary is completed, with all the music laid in. In fact, as we speak, sound and color correction, among the absolute final steps, are in the works. This has truly been a labor of love and I am thrilled to be so close to sharing it with you all.

Hi everyone,
I have some great news to report. Although the project has been delayed some, I am just weeks away from having a finished and final cut. I am really happy with the way it has turned out and I can not wait to share it.
Over the past few months I have been working really hard conducting a few last interviews, editing, and acquiring all the appropriate image and footage licensing for the project.

campaign.story:
Precision laser-cut and fully customizable.
                   "Its customizable nature also works as an educational jigsaw puzzle and helps break down complex pinhole technology to make it easier to understand." Jillian Wong, designTAXI
"At a time when the maker movement seems to be at its peak, Michael Kenney’s Original Pin project marks a merger between amusing, interactive entertainment and pinhole camera technology." Serena Chu, PSFK
"You can put together your Original Pin in no time at all. And once you’re done, just load up a standard roll of 35mm film and go for it. It’s more convenient than a standard pinhole camera and more visually appealing (at least we think so) than other build-it-yourself models." DL Cade, PetaPixel
"Building the camera also allows users to customize the look of their camera as well as understand the internal mechanics. The Original Pin takes standard 35mm that attaches to a film advance, while pulling the wooden slide on the front reveals the pinhole." Kevin Lee, Phoblographer
"Like the promotional DIY Leica camera, the Original Pin starts out as a bunch of snap-together pieces. However, the resulting product — a 35mm pinhole camera — can actually take pictures, while the Leica just looked, well, pretty. It’s also made from wood, if that appeals to your sense of aesthetics." Lee Booker, Gizmodo
Special thanks to Johanna Calderon-Dakin for providing us with attentive and invaluable PR and crowdfunding consulting!
Original Pin: Cameras with Character.
Teach the basics of photography with a precision-built, laser-cut 35mm pinhole camera that won't crush in your backpack, or melt in the rain, like cardboard. 
Through its customizable, flat-pack design, the Original Pin offers a user-friendly and intuitive method of changing your camera's "personality." By mixing and matching the wooden parts, you are able to create something that is both durable and unique.
Create your own camera. Simply.
A 3-D puzzle: If you can jigsaw, you can pinhole.
To create your Original Pin, simply match like-shapes. Then, add a dab of glue and a small helping of friction to create the inner-workings of the camera body. To complete the look, you can add your own custom parts to create a beautiful, functional and sturdy camera that will last you a lifetime.
Mix and match parts to create a custom camera.
The Best Way to Teach and Explore Photography: Pinhole technology. 
Most photography classes start with the construction of pinhole cameras. Why, you ask? Well, the pinhole camera breaks down complex photographic concepts into their basic foundation: Light. How much to let in, and for how long?
Hand-constructing a camera that can take real photographs, using the simplest method possible, transforms these abstract photographic concepts into hands-on understanding; giving both beginners, and veterans, a valuable tool for learning, exploring and creating their art.
Why create a pinhole camera from a shoebox or paint can that requires special photographic paper and a darkroom? With the Original Pin you can simply build a quality camera that takes standard 35mm film.
Enough of that: What you get and how it works.
The Original Pin will arrive as a flat-pack kit of parts, that you will assemble. The "basic" kit of part includes: (1) set of camera body parts, (1) faceplate, (1)shutter, (1)lens housing and (1) lens kit; which consists of a square piece of recycled aluminum, a size 22 sewing needle, a piece of 400 grit sandpaper and instructions for making the pinhole and assembling the Original Pin.
WE HAVE REACHED OUR GOAL! LET'S GO FOR THE STRETCH...
If we reach 20K we will be giving away the design files for the faceplate, lens ring and shutter pull, to every backer. That means if you have access to a laser cutter, or a laser cutting service, you can create your very own design!
For an idea of what is involved watch these animations:
Creating a film-winding post.
The finished post that will be inserted into the camera body to wind up the film.
Match like-shapes and add glue to create the camera body.
Start adding the parts you like.
Screwing on the lens and adding the shutter.
Seeing the guts of the operation.
Placing in the film. (It's functional!)
Tighten it up.
Putting on the backplate and winding up the film.
Snip. Snap. You'll be taking pictures in no time.
 Customizing your style.
The Cascadia model.
The Duwamish model.
The Seward model.
Kickstarter exclusive. Numbered in the order received.
Kickstarter exclusive faceplate design.
Removable tripod mounting.
Tripod mount in place.
Our very first set of pictures! 
We'll be adding new pictures as they come in from all of our Original Pin testers. Thanks, Justin Howard for the fantastic additions :)
Downtown Seattle from Queen Anne hill.
Reflections of a sunrise over Lake Union.
Boats in the marina.
The broken rocker.
The road not taken.
The upper Stillaguamish rocks.
The rain doth fall in Lake Quinalt.
The smoky harbor.
The other side.
Thank you Kickstarter!
Thanks a million for looking! Please give me any feedback or ask any questions, I would love to hear what you think!
If you love what you see, help me fund the dream :)
From the bottom of my heart, thank you for any interest you show in this project, whether it be a look, a like, a share, or a pledge. This project has demanded extensive passion and I am overjoyed to be able to share it with the world.
From the first moment of inception, over two years ago, I have labored to bring this idea to life. I feel truly grateful that I/we live in a time and place that allows an individual to dream, and do, what otherwise may have been impossible. The perfect nexus of affordable local prototyping (thanks, Metrix:CreateSpace, Seattle), manufacturing on demand, and crowd-funding, is truly a dream to behold.
For all of you dreamers, I say "Aye."
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The inherent risk is not being able to gauge the level of interest that may be shown in the Original Pin project. The biggest challenge would be an exponentially higher interest than I have anticipated. If that were to occur, I have contacted alternate producers that can help me deliver and distribute an overload of requests. As a result, I have identified a price point that will cover potential disruption.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
A Moment In Time
I often find myself dreaming my way into old photographs. I wonder what the moment would have been like - the people, the food, the smells. As with a time machine, photographs allow us to see directly into the past to experience a moment in time.
Photographers like Carlton Watkins, Edward Muybridge, and Ansel Adams among others, used the camera as a vehicle to show their love of place. Each of them worked in large format to get the sharpest, finest prints available at the time. I have been using a 4x5” film camera for over 25 years. Recently I have chosen to go back in time to an early photographic technology—that of wet plate collodion. 
What is wet collodion?
The following video gives an overview of the wet collodion process.
Collodion can be used on glass to make negatives or on tin to make tintypes.  I plan to make both as part of this project.
The Project
My project will involve making a small, but powerful, body of images of the Northern California Coast using 12x20" glass negatives and wet collodion. From these mammoth negatives, I will print directly on to albumen silver paper, resulting in stunning prints. At 150 times the size of a 35mm negative, the resolution is unsurpassed, allowing the viewer to visually step in to the photograph. How spectacular to be able to continue the tradition started in 1851 by early photographers and share these unique images for many years to come.
The Plan
Click to see project's regional scope.
I plan to visit at least ten locations between Monterey and Mendocino, and make several images in each location.  I have the fortunate ability to take my darkroom with me, as I have converted a travel trailer to allow me to make images wherever my truck and trailer can take me.  I will update you on where I have been or plan to go, and may post some of the images from time to time.  The more funding the project gets, the more places I can go.  Once the campaign reaches $5,000, or the project book level sells out, I will publish a book of select images, which will be sent to those who have contributed at each level that identifies a project book as a reward in the description.  A tour of my darkroom and ability to make a tintype yourself is even offered as a reward.
The Reality
Making collodion negatives and albumen prints can be quite costly. Beyond the cost of equipment, chemistry is expensive and each sheet of glass or plexiglass for the negative and each sheet of paper for printing can cost more than developing an entire roll of 35 mm film.  From start to finish, a 12x20" albumen print costs roughly $18. The negatives and prints are delicate and can break, scratch and spoil.  The chemistry, waste and time can add up quickly.  Contributions will be used to offset these photographic costs, as well as travel costs associated with the project.  The $5,000 campaign only begins to cover the expenses, so I encourage you to contribute at any level and spread the word!  Every bit counts, and is so very much appreciated.
Stretch Goals  
While I have set my campaign at $5,000, I would love to raise at least double that amount.  With additional funds, I can expand the project by visiting more locations and producing more beautiful images.  I might even be able to buy additional lenses for my camera.  Rest assured that funds raised will go to pay for equipment, supplies, expenses and production of rewards.  If I reach $7,500 in funding, everyone who has contributed to the campaign at a reward level will get a 12x20" digital print of an image of my choosing.  If I reach $10,000 in funding, everyone who has contributed to the campaign at a reward level will receive a signed 18x30" digital print of an image of my choosing (as an upgrade to the $7,500 stretch goal rather than a second print).  For contributions on or after 2/7/2014, contributions must be at or above the $100 level to receive a print.
Join Me
With your help, this journey of presenting the Northern California Coast through an historical photographic process can become a reality.  If you are interested in the project but can't contribute, please share it on Facebook, Twitter, or email it to a friend.  I hope you will join me.
Thank you
Chris Honeysett
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The challenges associated with this project are in making the negatives and photographs themselves – I don’t foresee many issues with completing the project once it is funded. Making a negative plate is an extremely time-consuming process and can be quite costly. Each negative plate has to be coated, sensitized, and exposed within the 10-15 minutes that the collodion is wet, or else the collodion hardens and the negative becomes unusable. Collodion is not like conventional film-because of the process and time involved. Each plate is totally unique, which in my opinion is one of the things that makes this such a rewarding art form. It can take half a day to get one good plate. I am thankful to have a supportive family that will allow me the time necessary to produce a beautiful body of work. I have a lot of patience and determination, and with over 30 years of experience in photography, I am confident this project will yield strong imagery that many will be able to enjoy.
Should fulfillment get delayed, I will make sure to stay in touch with my supporters and keep them abreast as to what is going on and why. I know from experience that a little information goes a long way to keeping clients happy.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hey everyone. I'm Scott Rivers and, well, I love to sing.  I've been singing for as long as I can remember.  I've been told that I even would sing in my sleep when I was a kid.  Not that any of you needed to know that. My first real solo, however, was when I was about 16.  The song was called Worthy To Enter and it changed my perspective on music.  You see this song was a prayer to God.  It was a prayer to God to make me worthy to enter his house and His presence.  Never had I felt such peace as I did while singing that song.  The feeling that came from sharing the Lord's message was so wonderful that I wanted to continue to do so as much as possible.
Now the time has finally come to record that album.  I feel like the time is right.  I have a wonderful musician working on the arrangements.  His name is Jared Pierce.  
Jared has performed all over the world including Europe, South America, throughout the United States. As a collaborative pianist, Mr. Pierce has worked with hundreds of singers, instrumentalists, and numerous choirs. Jared is currently serving as the accompanist for the Utah Chamber Artists.
He is currently a doctoral student in the piano program at the University of Utah. He received his M.M. degree in piano performance from Brigham Young University and his B.M. from California State University, Stanislaus.
So needless to say the creative portion of the album is in excellent hands.
I got to record my single at Soularium Recording Studios in Alpine, UT.  They were awarded Best Recording Studio in the State of Utah for 2013.  Their client list includes many big names including Disney, the Osmonds, and Air Supply, just to name a few.  So once again the quality of recording that is produced here is top notch.
I was able to record the first song a few months ago at Soularium.  This is the song heard in the background of the above video.  To listen to the full version of this song visit http://www.scottdrivers.com/music
So I'm asking you to get behind me, so that I can create something uplifting and beautiful to give to the world. Because of the high quality of talent that I am enlisting to create this album, the cost is going to be higher as well.  The money that you back me with will go towards the arranging, recording, mixing, and mastering the album as well as album artwork, marketing and the distribution.
Any money that is raised above the goal will go to making the album even better, with better studios and engineers, more studio time, more marketing and better distribution, etc.
I'm excited and thankful to have you on board as I take a big leap into this big musical world.
Scott Rivers
limited edition geometric intaglio print.
limited edition minimalist intaglio print.
An example of the hand bound journal/sketchbook(color options available)
 Composer Jared Pierce
Composer Jared Pierce
Jared Pierce is one of Utah’s rising generation of engaging, versatile, and entertaining pianists and composers. His performances have extended to Europe, South America, throughout the United States. As a collaborative pianist, Mr. Pierce has worked with hundreds of singers, instrumentalists, and numerous choirs. Jared is currently serving as the accompanist for the Utah Chamber Artists.
Some of his accomplishments include first place in the 2013 SummerArts Solo Piano Competition, the 2010 Earl and Marilyn Kruschke Prize for piano, first place in the 2008 CSU Stanislaus Concerto Competition, and first place in the 2006 Merced Symphony Concerto Competition.
Mr. Pierce is currently a doctoral student in the piano program at the University of Utah where he is studying with Susan Duehlmeier and Heather Conner. He received his M.M. degree in piano performance from Brigham Young University, where he studied with Irene Peery-Fox, Jeffrey Shumway, Scott Holden, and Richard Anderson. He received his B.M. from California State University, Stanislaus under the tutelage of Stephen Thomas. He has performed in the master classes of Nelita True, Norman Krieger, and Jon Nakamatsu. He also spent two summers at the prestigious Aspen Music Festival & School studying with renowned piano faculty from all around the world.

updates.update_content:
Finally after much waiting and anticipation and a little bit of stress, the CDs have been delivered.  Now the fun part of packaging and shipping them out to all of you gets to take place!  If you live in the Sacramento area then chances are you will have it hand delivered to you.  If you are in Rexburg, ID then that will most likely be the case as well.  All other locations will be shipped out to you, hopefully, by the end of the year. 
Thank you for your patience and support.  It has been a long road and I ave loved every step of it even though some of them may have added to my appearing gray hairs.  I hope you have a merry Christmas and a wonderful new year.

Hey everyone
New Addition
So it's been a while since I last sent out an update.  Well a lot has happened in the last two months.  All of them good and they have definitely kept me busy.

Hey everyone
So August is finally here.  For those of you following the timeline, August is the month designated for recording. Well I'm happy to say that we are still on schedule.  We have booked the studio on the 29th and 30th to start recording the piano tracks.  So hopefully we'll have the CD finished in the next couple months and out to you shortly after.

Well June is here and the songs are coming along. We've finalized the track list and I am pleased with the songs. Jared just sent me a sample of Lead Kindly Light and it's absolutely beautiful! The track list is as follows:
Jesus, Lover of My Soul
Lead Kindly Light
I Need Thee Every Hour
Nearer My God to Thee
The Lord is my Shepherd
Come unto Him
Abide with Me; Tis Eventide
Be Still My Soul
Where Can I Turn For Peace?
How Great Thou Art

Alright so it's been a while since I last updated all of you. It's been a little hectic for me the past few weeks. We just moved back up to Idaho for school and that's been full of surprises and challenges.
The album is slowly progressing. This is the most time consuming part. That is arranging all the music. Jared and I want to make sure that all the songs are perfect before we record any of them. This means writing and revising and then revising a little more. We are shooting for the month of August as our recording goal. That should get the album out in the fall. Thank you for all your love and support. If you have any questions feel free to email me at scottrivers_music@yahoo.com or write me on Facebook.

Hey for those of you who are wondering what a handmade hard bound journal/sketchbook looks like, I have added a picture of one that I made. They are part of the $250 reward level. So if you'd love a handmade book to keep your notes in, feel free to raise your pledge level. Treat yourself and help me reach my goal at the same time. We're down to 8 days.
Scott Rivers

Well we are coming to the end. If we are going to reach our goal we'll need a miracle. I still have a sliver of hope that we can do this. Talk to your friends, share it on Facebook, send emails... Everything helps. Remember it's all or nothing. Thank you for all of your support and love!
Scott Rivers

So we are coming down the homestretch.  21 days to go.  we have passed the $5000 and the $6000 marks thanks to some very generous backers.  With that said, we still have a long road ahead of us.  $10000 still to raise.  That is a lot of money.  I am looking into new ways of getting the word out.  So far nothing.  I have contacted newspapers and bloggers.  None of which have returned my emails.  The next step is to make a bunch of phone calls to those I know aren't on social media but who I feel would donate towards this project.  I don't expect any of you to raise your pledge level, but I would ask that you spread the word as much as possible.  Not only through social media but word of mouth.  Let your family and friends know about this project.

So last night we jumped the $4000 hurdle. We are now a quarter of the way there! Thank you to everyone for everything you've done to get to this point! Please keep sharing and spreading the word so we can get to $16000. I know we can do it!
Much appreciation, Scott

way to go Scott!!! made it
If all those of us who have already made a pledge increase our pledge by $20 today they will make it! What do you think? Can we do it?

campaign.story:
Missed getting a wallet on Kickstarter?
Visit MSTRMNDcollective.com
This wallet is slightly larger than a single credit card, sitting only an 1/8 of an inch thick and weighing just half an ounce. Don't let it's size fool you, though. We've designed this stylish wallet to hold everything you’ll need - from as little as a single card to over 10 cards plus cash, receipts and more. The easy-access thumb slot makes swiping your most frequently used cards a breeze, and when not in use, the SLIMplistic leaves an almost unseen imprint in either your front or back pocket.
We’ve taken the SLIMplistic as far as we possibly could on our own, and have now turned to our fellow Kickstarters for the support needed to fund and begin production. Your pledge will help us get one step closer to reaching our minimum goal of $5,000, allowing us to meet minimum production requirements, which then enables us to offer you the SLIMplistic Wallet at an affordable price.
With your pledge, you’ll receive a SLIMplistic Wallet in the color of your choice. Colors available include either black or brown, with stretch goals of at least 3 more additional colors (green, blue & red). You’ll also have your choice of choosing which logo embossment you prefer - plain (no color), silver, gold or black.
Thank you for taking the time to learn about the SLIMplistic, and thank you for your pledge. Your support is essential to making this project a reality and we couldn’t do this without YOU!
Take a look below to see the key features that make this one-of-a-kind wallet a step above the rest, as well as to see our Stretch Goals, where everyone wins!
Features
SUPER THIN
Only 1/8” of an inch (.125” inch) thick -- The same height as 2 quarters laying flat on top of each other -- making it both comfortable, and barely noticeable in either your front or back pocket.
TOP VIEW - Loaded with 6 credit cards and 4 paper bills.
SIDE VIEW - Loaded with 6 credit cards and 4 paper bills.
BACK VIEW - Loaded with 6 credit cards and 4 paper bills.
Which would you rather sit on?
SUPER LIGHTWEIGHT
It weighs ONLY .4oz -- Yes, less than half of one ounce, the same weight as just 2 quarters! Again adding comfort-ability while keeping it barely noticeable in any pocket.
SUPER STYLISH
With all edges tucking and rolling into each other, no detail was over looked, keeping it aesthetically clean, simple, balanced and modern.
SUPER CONVENIENT
The easy-slide ergonomic thumb slot is perfect for quickly accessing your most frequently used cards and essential for quick-swipe capability.
SUPER SECURE
Unlike other “slim” or “minimalist” wallets, which leave some or all of your wallet’s content exposed, we keep it all tucked away. The center-panel recessed-notch gives you access to press all of your cards easily, and securely into place below flush at the top, as well as access to remove the inner most cards with ease.
SUPER DURABLE
Made from the finest Italian leather, utility nylon fabric, and locally woven custom elastic, the SLIMplistic was intently designed with longevity in mind, capable of enduring the tests of even the most extreme lifestyles.
SUPER VERSATILE
This wallet is capable of holding as much or as little as you need. It securely holds anywhere from 1-15 cards, as well as cash, receipts, keys, or anything else you can imagine you’d need from your wallet.
SUPERB QUALITY
Not only is it made from the finest materials, it’s also manufactured right here at home, locally, by the finest leather workers. 100% designed, handcrafted and made in the USA.

Our Process & Progress
Don’t let its simple, sleek, design fool you. Over 8 months of designing, prototyping, product testing as well as an immeasurable amount of thoughtful planning went into refining and redesigning the wallet you see today.
Like many projects, the idea for the SLIMplistic Wallet came from necessity – a search for a problem that didn’t seem to yield a suitable solution – until now. One day we were just hanging out and somehow stumbled upon discussing how large and ridiculously fat our wallets were. We had quite a few laughs as we pulled them out comparing their sizes. This prompted us to look into solutions available online. And yes, there are options out there for smaller wallets, but all of them had at least one fatal flaw, making them completely unsuitable in our eyes.

Most of the wallets that claimed to be “slim,” either leave your cash exposed, a portion of your cards exposed, are difficult to use, or limit how much you can or can’t hold.

Our mission at this point was simple: Design something that is classy, slim, practical/easily accessible, fully encases all your cards and cash, and at the same time can expand to hold as much or as little as you need. The seed was planted and it was time to start sketching and testing some designs.
It started with some collaborative brainstorming and about 10 sketches. From there it was time to gather supplies and make some homemade prototypes.
After making and testing the various designs that made the most sense, we whittled down the list to a single superior design, which we then began to refine.
Once we reworked and tested our prototype, we took our idea to a local manufacturer who we’ve partnered up with to help further fine-tune our wallet. Working together hand-in-hand, we’ve experimented with alternative materials and different techniques.
After roughly half a dozen more tweaks, improving the SLIMplistic's performance in addition to making it production friendly, we’ve completed the prototype process, product testing, and brought us to where we are today.
Final Design/Construction Process

Our Manufacturing Plan – The Next Step & Beyond
We are now ready to take the next step forward and begin production. Once successfully funded, we will be able to purchase all the materials and final tooling needed to produce the SLIMplistic on a large enough scale to fulfill your pledge rewards as promised. Our manufacturer already houses all the materials and equipment needed to begin and complete the job, so there will be no lead-time needed in this area. We’ve been given a conservative estimate of 2 weeks to complete our first production run. As we’ve mentioned a couple times throughout this campaign, the leather shop we are working with has been around for over 40 years, is family owned, and are a great group of people. We couldn’t ask for anyone more qualified to bring this project to life.
We will begin production as soon as we meet our initial goal of $5,000. At this time we will also order our packaging for your wallets. We’ve been given a 10-day lead-time on the delivery of the packaging from our local print house (who we’ve used before on other projects), which means we should have the packaging in-hand several days before the wallets themselves. As we receive the wallets they will be inspected for quality control, and packaged. Once our campaign comes to a close, and funds are transferred, we will immediately ship you your wallet/rewards!
Take a peek into just one of the rooms that houses some of the machines that will be used in the production of your wallet:
Just a few of the many sewing machines available.
Oh yeah, here are a few more.
One of the dies used on the pneumatic press for our prototypes.
Here is the die of our logo and the press used to emboss it.
Because of you and your pledge, our future is bright and we plan on continuing to offer the SLIMplistic Wallet online through our website. Once all of your rewards are fulfilled and shipped, we will begin production of our website, MSTRMNDcollective.com.
Stretch Goals
Don't get us wrong, we're not trying to be cocky, and we'll be ecstatic if we reach our minimum goal... But with a potential opportunity to over-fund our project, we'd love to show our extreme gratitude to our backers. So, as an extra THANK YOU and incentive for you to share our project with your friends and family, everyone who pledges will be eligible to receive these extra rewards!
Stretch Goal: $10,000
All pledges receive MSTRMND key chain (up-cycled from your actual wallet!)
Stretch Goal: $15,000
All pledges receive a MSTRMND sticker pack (4 stickers)
Stretch Goal: $25,000 - Unlock Color: Kickstarter/Envy Green
Stretch Goal: $30,000 - Unlock Color: Pretty Pink
Stretch Goal: $35,000 - Unlock Color: Bright Blue
Stretch Goal: $40,000 - Unlock Color: Cool White
Stretch Goal: $45,000 - Unlock Color: Rich Red
These and more stretch goal Fem-freindly colors to come!

Thank you!
We’re extremely confident that everything will go off without a hitch and we will keep all of you up-to-date with emails on the status of your SLIMplistic Wallet. We sincerely appreciate the support and can't say it enough, so here's the last one - Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
To say we’ve worked diligently to minimize all risks would be a vast understatement. Without boring you to death, we’ll point out just some of the crucial steps we’ve taken to ensure you everything goes smoothly and is produced on time with no hiccups:

We’ve partnered with the perfect local manufacturer. They’ve been operating for over 40 years, have a wealth of experience, great capable staff, and happen to house all materials needed for this project. We’ve timed the production process from the first cut of leather to the last stitch. From the finished product being inspected, boxed and bagged, to printing and applying the label and postage and dropping it off at the post office. That’s given us a realistic estimated delivery date. We’ve even calculated all lead times on additional materials in the event that we surpass our initial Kickstarter goal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Our Kickstarter campaign is over, but you can still get a Practical Meter. Head over to thepowerpot.com for more info and to place an order.

How Fast Are You Charging?
It's more common than you think. You plug in your phone, it says 'charging', but do you know how fast? Millions of people deal with slow charge times from their PCs or laptops, and they don't even realize it. Slow charging rates happen because of different standards for high-powered USB and can result in charge times exceeding six hours! We are introducing the Practical Meter to help you solve these slow charge times.
Know Your Power
Smartphones have become an essential part of our lives. Keeping them charged is more important than ever, but today's phones often die before the day is through. This makes charging at top-speed mandatory. Currently, there is no way to know if your phone is charging fast or slow. The Practical Meter changes this. It displays real-time charge rates of any USB device so you know how fast you're charging.
Do you ever use a PC/computer to charge at work or home? Let's plug in the Practical Meter and find out how quickly it charges an iPhone.  Using the factory cable, we only get 2.5 watts. This is only 50% of the max charging speed, which means this phone will take 4+ hours to charge! Plug the same setup into a Mac and now it behaves like it should, charging in 1.5 hours at top speed (5 watts).
Android Too
The same thing happens with most Android models on both Macs and PCs. This is because there are different standards for putting a full 5-watts into a USB device. iPhone has its own standard, Android uses another and so on.
To solve this we developed a 3-in-1 charging cable, that optimizes charge times with iPhone, Android as well as Mini USB.
Rewards: Charge Faster!
Note: Single orders ONLY. You can order additional units after we fund.
Stretch Goals
Use It Everywhere
The Practical Meter helps you know your power with no added cables and no engineering degree required! Plug it into any USB port and charge the same way as before. Watch your power output change from one device to the next.
Portable Generators
Unsurprisingly portable USB chargers like solar panels and battery packs also have their share of compatibility issues. A common example is shown in the video, when poor positioning reduces power to less than one-watt. Smartphones may indicate they are charging but the Practical Meter tells us that they aren't receiving any power. This can be solved by repositioning your solar panel and using the Practical Meter to find the sweet spot.
Keep Charging!
Our 3-in-1 charging tip maximizes power draw to help you charge faster. Use it on any USB port to ensure your phone is charging at top speed.
Let's visit our previous example, we charge an iPhone on a PC and get charge times exceeding 4 hours. We switch out the factory cable with ours and voila! The charge rate doubles, and our charge time is now under 2 hours!
Tech Details
The Practical Meter fits into any USB port and displays the charge rate of any device. Just plug it in and charge as you normally would. Smartphones charge at 5-watts max, so we added 5 LED lights, each representing 1 watt of power.
When all five bars are lit, your phone will charge at top speed, between 1 and 2 hours. If the meter only shows 2 or 3 watts, you'll be waiting for up to 6 hours for your phone to charge. Knowing your power will help you maximize charge times by choosing the best charging cables for your device. 
The Practical Meter uses a microcontroller to read the output data from a current sensor.  It averages this measurement over a few seconds and illuminates the number of LEDs corresponding to the measured power using the relation: Power = Voltage x Current. This design gives you simple real-time visual feedback while charging your devices. The Practical Meter meter itself weighs 0.3 ounces (8.5 g) and consumes less than 1/10 of a watt at maximum.  The optimized charging tips are for charging only and do not allow data transfer. However, the Practical Meter by itself will allow you to transfer data so you can monitor power use while transferring music or pictures. 
High Power Mode allows you to measure up to 10 watts for higher powered devices such as iPads and tablets.
Press Kit
Check out our Press Kit. Pictures can be reused freely on any medium.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Practical Meter's beauty is its simplicity. You don't need to know about voltages and amperage to understand how much power you're getting. We've done a lot of leg work to make sure things go smoothly once our project funds. Its been prototyped and revised several times and is ready for mass production. We have manufacturing arranged, but to meet minimum order and tooling costs, we need your help. With your support, we will be able to mass produce a high-quality, injection-molded Practical Meter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Backers,
We’re excited to introduce our tenth Kickstarter campaign with our latest products built completely from the ground up. Say goodbye to the fossil-fueled, disposable lighters of the past and hello to the electric, USB rechargeable future that gives you more flexibility to light up anything, anywhere, and in ANY direction.

campaign.story:
The Fit Right Bowtie: Fancy enough for you, but will Fit Right on your pet!™
Have you ever noticed that in every picture of a dog wearing a bowtie, the dog is sitting up or the picture is taken from below? That's because dogs have been wearing bowties that were designed for humans!  And since (most) dogs don't walk up-right, their bowties have been hidden under their necks.
But not anymore! The Fit Right Bowtie™ is the first dog bowtie that was actually designed to fit correctly on a dog! It stays visible as your dog walks and moves, so they can stay fancy while still being quadrupeds!
The product is designed, physical samples are approved, the packaging is ready, and the manufacturer is waiting on us! We just need your support to get this going!  Here are the expected first run colors and patterns:
Watch Luigi's video as he prepares for a date with Ashley!
Special Occasions Require Special Attire!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks are minimal, because the manufacturing process is ready to go! 

The real challenge is funding, which is why I'm on Kickstarter. I can have the bowties produced in small runs, but it really isn't feasible. I need funding in order to kick off an actual "production" run and essentially kick start the Fit Right Bowtie! 

One of the difficulties in textiles is reproducing a product using the exact same fabric, because only enough bolts of a specific fabric are secured for the production run. This won't be an issue on future runs, because the idea is to have endless styles and patterns. However, it may cause us to run out of certain colors for the backers of our project. So once we're funded, I'll ask each of our backers for their color choice(s) along with a couple of backup color choices. Hopefully everyone will get exactly what they want, but I'm asking everyone to be understanding just in case we run out of a specific color.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.creator_bio:
Steve Venturino
First created · 6 backed
Steve grew up in Northern California, and has always loved the outdoors. His little buddy Luigi, a Cavalier King Charles Spaniel, shared...See more

updates.update_content:
Thank you for supporting my Fit Right Bowtie project! And although I am disappointed that this project didn't fund—if you live in California you will be able to buy the Fit Right Bowtie at Pet Food Express this Holiday Season!
Thanks you again for your pledges and support!!!

campaign.story:
Progress as of 7-18-13
Stretch Goals One, Two, Three and Four Achieved! - Every backer $1+ will be drawn into a thank you image and can download my comic book here. All backers $15+ get a Color-Me-Comicosm and Spider-Mania. The basic print has changed from 18x24" to 24x36".
Reward Breakdown
Comicosm 2 is the fourth installment in my on ongoing series attempting to encapsulate the Entire Cartoon Universe. This drawing includes over 2,000 characters from a list that I have collected and culled over the past five years. The work takes inspiration from the complex drawings of Mad Magazine and Where's Waldo as well as the detailed meditational art of Tibet. 
Two months of work in two seconds!!
Zoom into the project in Black and White.
Algebraic!!!
I have brought the project to Kickstarter to fund the printing of 18" by 24" prints of the completed color image. For your reward, I will be sending out the prints with a characters guide and a suggested set of rules for playing with the piece. Of course you can always simply hang it on the wall... but I also want to give a gamified option for interacting with this piece. 
Coloring, every day.
Just to give you a sense, you can find three Triforce pieces, five Golden Tickets, eight red Mario coins, seven Palantirs, seven Chaos Emeralds, 101 (Yes, I counted) Dalmations and, of course, one Waldo (plus like 50 Waldo and Cat in the Hat hats :)) 
Can you spot King Boo, Ralph Wiggum or the Magic School Bus?
I'll be developing a rules, patterns and a point system over the next month so if anyone has ideas, I'd love to hear them. I am also absolutely open to character suggestions and would love it if you wrote your most desired characters in the comments section. 
In 2009 I made the Comicosm, a 9' by 6' oil painting with 1,546 characters. That's my cat JFK, the Jerk Face Kitty in front.
Thank you for your interest and continued support. I am still amazed at the kindness and enthusiasm that this mode of working allows. It's a true gift that the audience can be as big an inspiration as the subject.
...
Posted below is a video by Yuyu Chen for the New York Times East Village Blog. It serves as an excellent primer if you are unfamiliar with my work.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am just about to fulfill the rewards on my most recent project. I have handled multiple projects at different phases of completion in the past and am confident I can handle everything I have laid out for myself.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!
I hope the fall is treating you well!
I've just launched a new project to fund my biggest picture to date and I wanted to tell you first. I'm funding a yearlong studio residency where I'll produce and document a crazy complex cartoon universe.

Hey backers!
I am shipping the final rewards (t-shirts and guides) this weekend. If your address has changed in the past year, send me a message, please! I'm extremely excited to get these final promises fulfilled. Once everything is shipped out I'll share the images and PDFs with you in an update.
It's been a long road and you've been so patient. I'm happy to almost have this all complete.

Long time no speak, backers! How's 2015?
Believe it or not, I am still plugging away to get this project wrapped. :) It's close. 
The T-shirt finally came together in a way I am really excited about. The order is out of my hands and will be delivered within a month. I am ridiculously happy about that. I think people will be happy with the reward they have waited so patiently (for sooooo long) for.

Dear backers,
I just launched a new project. This time, I'll be focusing less on my own creative effort and more on getting you (and everyone I can convince) to commit a creative act. It's a MASSIVE COLLABORATIVE DRAWING. For $10 you can contribute art to a whopping community project. It's an easy and fun way to get your art (or the art of a loved one) out and involved.

updates.update_userinfo: New Project: A way to share your art!
updates.update_content:
A fair question. Im okay! Working hard and keeping positive! Comicosm 2, Spider-Mania and the Golden Tickets are hanging around the world! That's pretty neat!
Let's get to business. People should have all received something by now. There may be a few international packages still trickling in... Please let me know if you haven't gotten at least one shipment. You're likely still waiting for 1) the guide 2) the digital backer drawing and 3) the tee-shirt. These are in various states of completion but all are coming. Thanks for your patience!

updates.update_userinfo: What ever happened to Ray Sumser?
updates.update_content:
First I owe a ton of people apologies.
There are number of international shipments that have not gone out. They are mostly for backers in the UK, Autralia and Canada, but not only.
All people who backed for T-Shirts are still waiting.
All backers are still waiting on the YOUniverse drawing and the guide.

Hi Everyone. I probably owe you about twenty updates by now.
I'll start with the important stuff - - 
1. Most of the internationals shipped last week. There are a few left to get out the door and I want to apologize for making some of you wait so long. Your patience is ultimately as invaluable as your initial support for the project was. THANK YOU!

Hi kickstarters!
I hope you are all enjoying the new year. New York is slushy.
So: All international shipments will be out of my studio by the end of next week. I know you have been incredibly patient and I really appreciate it. I don't want to make excuses but the start of the year required a huge amount of catch up after the whirlwind end of 2013. Regardless, I'm sorry for your wait and thank you again for your patience.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The prototypes you see here have been tested over months and we are quite happy with their performance. As as result, we are optimistic about the prospects of meeting the deadline. Just in case something unexpected comes up, the timeline has some built-in cushioning. 

Because we have been able to test the prototypes thoroughly, we are not too worried about having any major functional complications when we go into production. Our manufacturing partner is a wonderful woman named Melissa who we have worked with on other projects in the past. Her quality is outstanding and she manufactures kitchen products for some of the top brands like Alessi, Oxo, and Prepara. It is important to us that we collaborate at each stage of the project with established professionals we can rely on. 

This is our first time shipping goods ourselves. Usually we do the design work, verify the quality of the production and then the boats, planes, trains and trucks are all up to other people. In order to protect the project from rookie mistakes, we are partnering with industry leader DHL for the transport of the goods from the factory to the distribution center in Los Angeles. 

This distribution centre is part of the Shipwire network and our new best friend Steve at Shipwire is going to hold our hand through each stage of getting the rewards shipped out in a timely and organized fashion. (Thank you Steve!)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hello Original Food Huggers!

updates.update_userinfo: Bowl Huggers Special for Kickstarter Backers
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
We know that many of you enjoy backing Kickstarter projects for the "behind the scenes" view of the start-up process so we thought we would share some of our recent news with you.
The Web Store is Open

updates.update_userinfo: Small Multi-Packs Are Back and a New Design is Soon Revealed
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
Thank you so much for your kind words and all the great pictures and notes you have sent about how much you are enjoying your Food Huggers. Your support continues to inspire us and make our days! Thank you.
All of the Kickstarter rewards were shipped out more than six weeks ago. Everyone should have received their packages by now. If you have not received your Food Huggers, please email us (hugs@foodhuggers.com) and let us know so that we can track down your shipment. The postal system is complex and hard to predict (Australia and New Zealand orders arrived before Germany and Spain??). We are committed to making sure all of our Kickstarter supporters get their rewards and do not want to see any of you miss out on your hugs!

Hello Everyone!
We just wanted to send you all an update to let you know that if you are still waiting for your Food Huggers, you are not alone.  Everything has shipped out as promised and we expect that all of you who are planning to stuff stockings with Food Huggers will have them in time.

Hello Everyone and Happy Thanksgiving!
This has been an amazing experience and one that will never be forgotten by either of us. We expect that all of you in the US will have your Huggers within the next couple of days if you do not already have them.
Many thanks to everyone who has tweeted and posted their first Food Hugs on Facebook and Twitter. Thank you so much for spreading the word. Your messages are definitely being heard as we have had a nice spike in the sales on our website.  You guys are the BEST!!!

campaign.story:
All armatures are the 2013 version!
NEW! If you don't have an Amazon account and wish to pay through paypal you can still pre-order these armatures at these great discount prices through my online storefront (only through June 16th!)
YES, COMBINE ANY REWARDS  YOU WANT. Just do the math, contribute the right amount in the $1 catch-all reward listed at the top, and you'll get to fill out a survey at the end of the campaign where you can specify on what rewards you'd like your money spent. 
Video 1: My first silly video pitch featuring my kids here
Video 2: Second video pitch (for concept artists) here
Video 3: Video showing how pieces work (via assembly) here
Video 4: Does this 3D printed product break easily? Video here
ITEM PRICES
(everything still available)
(prices include shipping within the US for international shipping add %15)

2 Minis - $10

A9-11" - $30

A9-Child - $25

Total if all ordered: $329 (Retails for: $438)
(price includes shipping within the US)  
Bundles are sold out, sorry :(
Use this $1 tier to customize your own order. For orders outside of the US please add %15 to your order to account for shipping.
Note: Select this tier to customize your own order. If you only contribute $1, however, you will not be getting any product in return but you will get access to exclusive content for backers in my updates. To get an actual product, please add the right amount after selecting this tier. Everything is still available!
2 MINI ARMATURES
8 HAND VARIANTS
Pledge $1 and you'll become a backer with access to exclusive content!
4 FOOT VARIANTS
4 FACE VARIANTS
5.5" Armature
3 TORSO VARIANTS
CAT Armature 
Pledge $1 and you'll become a backer with access to exclusive content!
DOG Armature
1 ADULT 11" Armature
HAND 1-1 Scale
HORSE Armature
Pledge $1 and you'll become a backer with access to exclusive content!
QUADRUPEDS BUNDLE !! (photo coming soon)
HUMANS BUNDLE
ALL HUMANS & QUADRUPEDS! (photo coming soon)
ABSOLUTELY EVERYTHING! (photo coming soon)
 All of the above plus a digital double of your own face!
Armature Pair + Digital Illustration Class
Armature Pair + 3D Printing Class
More pictures coming (Will be posting pictures for each reward)
Hey Kickstarter community! 
I reaaaalllly want to get this cool little figure I made into the hands of retailers, but they won't pay me any attention until I can prove I can manufacture them in large quantities and be able to do so quickly. So what do you think? Can a 3D printed product get into retail stores? 
I believe the answer is yes but first let me tell you about this cool product and then my plan to get there. You're probably familiar with those wooden unisex dolls in craft stores for artists, right?  You know, the ones with those funny looking ball joints? Well, haven't you wished they made them with the proper proportions and range of motion? Yes? Well so did I, and that's what I set off to do. 
After many months of design, 3D printing and iteration, and a thorough four month beta phase with over 800 armature shipped around the world. I've finally come up with a design that has been tested and proven and a production and shipping pipeline well established.
This figure, has been designed to simply and accurately portray the human anatomical proportion with a range of motion capable of posing it realistically. Unlike the wooden dolls that are currently out in the market, these, are way more accurate and are better suited to meet the needs of artists and, in fact, has already had positive impacts on my own art.
Through this kickstarter I'm releasing the new, 2013 version of the design and also a number of new products and enhancements such as quadrupeds, a 1-1 hand armature, various proportional and anatomical variations and more!
So why help me out? The thing is, I've been manufacturing these myself with 3D printers and as you can imagine, it's painfully slow. Right now I can produce about 10 of the large armatures a day, which does not including assembly or possible failure-rate (there's good days and bad days).  Consequently, there's little to no hope of getting it into retail storefronts, as they need to be assured they can order 100-200 on a moment's notice.
Getting this product into retail stores is the only way this armatures will get the exposure it really needs in order to thrive and become the livelihood I need it to be in order to put food on the table.   If I make my goal, I can raise enough money to expand my equipment and include ten (10) 3D printers, With these I'd be able to produce 50 armatures a day! This kind of output will allow me to meet the initial needs of retail stores in addition to online orders.
In exchange for your support, I'm offering many of these armatures at a 25% discount (even over %50 if you get the $200 bundle) and even offering some armatures that will never be available through retail OR my website (such as the 5.5" armature). Meeting this kickstarter goal will allow me to add the additional printers to my arsenal and pay for the materials and shipment of the rewards you pledge on. My time would be unpaid and would constitute my contribution to the campaign. I'll be handling all the printing, assembly, shipping and the package design for retailers.
Please support my grassroots attempt to manufacture this product. Even if you're not an artist, any of these rewards would make a great gift for any artist friends you have.
Special Note:
Only those that contribute to this campaign will get their armatures in this limited edition color (pearl & crimson). If you prefer the default brown with dark trim, you can opt out of this choice by saying so in the comments (but you can't back out after you do). The pearl color, uses little to no pigmentation and so it is slightly translucent (similar to skin & marble, so it will provide you with more realistic shading when doing your value samples)
To learn more about how to use these armatures for illustration, watch the video listed at the top.
Credits: 
Music by Mariya Lincoln & DjembeDJ
Filmed by Kevin Harris
Note: I Photoshoped away the background because it had a nasty texture to it
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I launched a crowd-funding campaign to release a Beta version of this product late last year with over 800 armatures ordered: (http://www.indiegogo.com/armature9)

I was very thorough and transparent with my fulfillment of orders by providing this public spreadsheet to all contributors so they could track my progress:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0ArJsKv5h1IsCdFJCN2QyUUh5N1lselJCWURwVjQxQ1E&usp=sharing


And I learned a TON! I faced a number of unexpected issues and learned how to resolve them. As a consequence, I established a sustainable and efficient production and assembly pipeline. Am in the process of solidifying a relationship with a filament supplier. Found an excellent technician to help me with repair issues. Resolved a number of design problems based on feedback I got from customers. Registered with a bulk mailing service and learned how to assemble and package the armatures efficiently. I learned an incredible amount about manufacturing with 3D printers in general and how to get consistent repeatable and non-brittle results. 

In short, I've really crossed my t's and dotted my i's so that I could launch this much larger campaign. So I see very little risk to you, the contributor. I'm sure, however, I will continue to learn new things, once, and if, you help me get my foot in the door of retailers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
